name: S.O.S Tortues
description:
S.O.S Tortues is an ecologic game about the marine turtles for 2 to 6 players.

In S.O.S Tortues, each player must protect his specie of turtle and avoid the fisher. If a player lose all his tokens, he becomes a fisher. At the end, the player with the higher number of tokens wins the match.

Each turn, the players can move or stay, when he moves a player must resolve the effects of the arrival square and the face-down card. If he stays, the player draws two face-down cards from the supply, he keeps one card and gives the other card to another player, then the cards effects are resolved. After all players, the fisher(s) move(s) and try to rapt turtles.

name: Ninja All-Stars: Uzumaki
description:
Description from the publisher:

Uzumaki is a Clan Kitsune-themed Hero for Ninja All-Stars. Heroes bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. Each Hero is themed to a single clan and make must-have additions for players who pick up the clan box.

Uzumaki is unlike his otherwise reclusive Kitsune kin. Where others recoil at the sight of travelers, Uzumaki is often the first to greet them and offer them warding runes and medicines in exchange for stories of the world beyond his clans’ hallowed forests. Social, skilled, and savvy, he is ill-suited for the more solemn life his clan’s spirit-haunted trees offer. For these reasons, he has been sent to the Moonlight Tournament as their first ever envoy in over a century.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Sly, Spirited Kitsune Clan Hero
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Sports, Video Game Theme

name: Ninja All-Stars: Moon Princess
description:
Moon Princess is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

Schooled since birth in the ancient, esoteric arcana of her family, the Moon Princess sometimes tires of merely watching the Moonlight Tournament. She often desires to use her own strange and terrible power against the warriors competing to do her honor. Yet, competing in the tournament exposes her to threats, assassination attempts, and even death. In truth, though, these dangers are part of what makes these outings so appealing to her.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Majestic and Magical Moon Princess
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Sports, Video Game Theme

name: Clone Wars Adventures Trading Card Game
description: The Clone Wars Adventures Trading Card Game is a trading card game based on the mini-game Card Commander from Clone Wars Adventures MMO. Duel your opponent with cards featuring characters, ships and vehicles from Star Wars: The Clone Wars! When you win a duel, attack one of your opponent's hidden bases. Reveal the base's defense and destroy it! When you destroy your opponent's last base, you win!

name: Good Little Trains
description:
In Good Little Trains, players become train drivers eager to delivery their cargo to the ring of colourful stations connected by an ever-changing layout of tracks.

Every turn you have a chance to switch one piece of track before both your own train and the neutral 'Ghost' train both head out across the network of rail lines. Aim to drop your own cargo at the most valuable stations, while also having an eye on where the Ghost train is headed, and what your competitors are up to!

If at the end of a turn all the stations of one colour have cargo, then those stations are scored. All players can earn points for their cargo, and the player who triggered the scoring gets a coin. Once all 10 coins have been taken, the game ends and the player with the most points is the winner.

Good Little Trains is the first product of a new collaboration between the co-designers of 'Elysium', 'Costa Rica, 'Pyramids and 'Professor Evil and the Citadel of Time'. All these new games will be available as free print-and-play downloads from the Good Little Games website, alongside the existing catalogue of free microgames including the original editions of Pocket Imperium, Empire Engine and Bad Grandmas.
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Hengen Kaitou J -Fantomu Daiya no Himitsu-
description:
User summary
変幻怪盗J　～ファントムダイヤの秘密～ (Hengen Kaitou J -Fantomu Daiya no Himitsu-) in English is 'The Everchanging Phantom Thief J -Secret of the Phantom Diamond-'. The 怪盗 (Phantom Thief) theme is quite popular in Japan, from Arsene Lupin or Lupin the Third, or recently, Persona 5 from the Persona series in console games.

A card game with a phantom thief theme, the game has hidden role assignment. The cards are placed in a circle on the table, and the mission is to find the appropriate card in there. The Phantom Thief will win when the Heroine is found, or the Cops will win when they find the Phantom Thief.

To win, you must control the Squad card moving on the circle of cards, and execute the "charge in" card at the appropriate position.

Publisher's summary
テーマは怪盗。テーブルの中央に環状に伏せられたカードの中から、怪盗役は「ヒロイン」カードを、刑事役は「怪盗J」カードを探しあてれば勝利です。
勝利条件を満たすには、伏せられたカードの上を移動する「機動隊」カードをうまく制御して、目的のカードの上に「機動隊」カードが来た時に「突入」カードを使います。

name: Tokyo Ghoul: The Card Game
description:
Tokyo Ghoul: The Card Game: a strategic, turn-based deck building card game for 2 to 4 players. Using allies with different skills and abilities, players struggle to become the top ghoul in a deadly turf war. Combining well known deck building with direct combat, Tokyo Ghoul: The Card Game encourages thoughtful decision making and carefully planned strategies to win. Tokyo Ghoul: The Card Game is based on the hit anime and manga sensation Tokyo Ghoul, enjoyed by tens of millions of fans worldwide. The game allows players to build a deck of their favorite ghouls in a strategic game of pitched battles where only the strongest will survive. Tokyo Ghoul: The Card Game is sure to be a hit with fans of dark fantasy and Tokyo Ghoul.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Monster Dice
description:
The Toy Box Monsters YOU ROLL! Become Kids of Legendary Monsters. Collect the Most Candy on Halloween.

The legendary monsters that we grew up with, now have kids of their own. In Monster Dice, you become little monsters rolling through the neighborhood trying to get the most candy on Halloween.

Open the box to reveal your 8 Monster Dice and Candy Cards. This is everything you need to play various mini-games that will test your speed, reflexes, and hand-eye coordination.

—description from the publisher

name: Black Stories: Uni Edition
description:
A Game: Black Stories edition with riddle stories with a university background.

Black Stories are tricky, morbid, sinister riddle stories. The players try to reconstruct the particulars of each incident, piece by piece, by asking yes-or-no-questions.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
publishers: G3, Gen-X Games, moses. Verlag GmbH, Tucker's Fun Factory B.V.

name: Afrika!
description:
This is a small wargame of the African campaign from March 1941 to August 1942.
Both the German player and the British player pull supply chits to do operations each game turn.
First game of "long-map mini game trilogy".
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Point to Point Movement

name: American Trivia Game
description:
Standard trivia style game with questions specifically geared to an American audience.

Learn all about your country with the American Trivia Game! This one-of-a-kind game was created exclusively for Books Are Fun and features over 2,000 fun-filled, all-American questions in four categories—Geography, History, Arts, and General. You’ll discover: Who signed the Declaration of Independence first? The second largest city in Oklahoma Who wrote the poem “America the Beautiful”? Which team won back-to-back Super Bowls during the 1990s? And more! Complete with full-color game board, instruction sheet, 540 playing cards, 8 playing pieces, and 30 “Uncle Sam” cards, it’s the perfect way to brush up on all the fascinating facts and figures about the United States. For ages 12 and up.

name: Treachery in a Pocket: Margaret the Witch Promo Card
description:
Add to Treachery in a Pocket with this Margeret the Witch promo card!

Text: "When Attacked, instead of becoming Wounded, create a new row below this one and move her there."
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Renaissance

name: Goodbye, Ghosts!
description:
Goodbye, Ghosts! is an adorably fun card game in which you effort to be the first to purge your house of phantoms—by matching one ghost, to another!

The dealer begins by separating the game equally among all players, creating a deck for each their own. After that, everyone draws 5 cards from their deck and the player to the dealer's left begins.
When it is their turn, players draw a card and then play any number from their hand to the middle discard pile, face up. The card they play must match the one in the middle, either by its color or the expression on the ghost's face.
If the player has emptied its hand (playing all its five cards), he-she may draw 5 other cards and continue its streak.
When the current player is unable to discard a ghost from its hand, the turn is finished and the next player plays.
The game contains Rainbow ghosts that can be played at any moment during the player's turn to change the color of the pile to the player's choosing.

The first player to get rid of all his ghosts win, to get rid of a ghost, match the color or expression of the current top card of the pile. If nobody can play cards anymore, the player with the fewest cards wins.

—description from the designer

name: 5 Stack
description:
5 Stack is an exciting chip stacking game with the perfect mixture of strategy and chance. 5 Stack is simple enough that a 5-year-old can play it and interesting enough to captivate the seasoned board game veteran. Proudly made in the USA, components include a game board, coloured wooden chips, dice, scoring pad, and instructions. Designed by Jackson Robinson, and published by Kings Wild Project.

To set-up: Players all get 25 chips in their colour plus a single gold coin, and dice are rolled for a random set-up that adds five chips per player to a 6x6 game-board.

To play: In clockwise order players take turns to: (a) move a chip or a chip stack of their colour in a straight direction on the board; (b) place a new chip with the location determined by a dice roll. The game ends when someone has played all their chips and cleared all chip stacks under their control.

To win: The aim of the game is to score the highest number of points. Points are scored by clearing a stack (when a stack under your control reaches 5 or more chips, with gold chips being worth 5 instead of 1 point each). Your final score is the total number of "cleared" chips minus any of your unplayed and uncleared chips at game end.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Set Collection

name: Guardians of Wayword
description:
Guardians of Wayword is a dice-building tabletop game set in a unique world of fantasy that contains characters from many gothic horror and fantasy settings.

Setting up the game, player will randomly select a "Big Bad", Scenario, and the soldiers and lackeys of the "Big Bad". Their tokens go into a bag that is drawn and played from on each Player Turn. Then, players select a Guild to represent, and take turns drafting their Agents, Items, Scrolls and anything else useful for the Game. This creates their personal inventory to create their dice pool as the game evolves.

Over the course of the game, players will increase their Agents and Inventory's power and influence in the game. Each die bought makes your Guilds ability to resolve threats, respond to morale loss and fight the horrors of the dark! Players dice are bought from the cards they drafted at the beginning of the game as well as a few public Agents players can recruit from.

At the beginning of a player's turn, they pull a token from the Threat Bag and add it to the city space furthest from Wayword. As each city space fills up, threats begin flooding closer and closer to the city of Wayword. Along the way, Civilians may be injured, cities and locations may be destroyed but the real threat comes from foes reaching Wayword. If Wayword collapses, all the players lose. The Threat Bag also includes the "Big Bad", who may get so fed up with his Troop's ineffectiveness, that they show up to cause their own brand of trouble! On top of all of that, the variable Scenarios in game may affect any aspect of play, from doubling Threat Bag draws to letting threats and foes move further towards Wayword but faster.

As Guilds build up their Agents and Inventory, they will defeat these baddies, stop these threats and rescue these Villagers. All of these things are worth Popularity Points (Victory Points) from the people of Wayword. If players confront and defeat the "Big Bad", the game comes to an end and Wayword can rest easier!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Wet Blanket
description:
It's time to party!
...NOT!

This is a game where you try to make people leave a party and go to your own instead!
Implement a series of cards designed to make everyone have a terrible time at the current party. Whoever collects the most party guests wins!

Game Objective: Each player is a wet blanket that wants to break up a party by causing socially awkward situations. The person with the most people in their personal party by the time the main party is emptied or ended wins the game.

Start out with 8 guests in the middle of the table, which represents the current party. Each player is dealt 4 cards, on their turn a player plays a card then draws back up to 4.

Multiple card types include:
Party Guest
Disaster
Event
Food/Music
Veto
Super Veto

name: Rory's Story Cubes: Mix Vol. 1
description:
Roll dice and use the pictures to tell wild and crazy stories!

This set of Rory's Story Cubes that contains three previously issued sets: Prehistoria, Clues, and Enchanted. They can be used as a set or mixed with other Rory's Story Cube sets.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Solo / Solitaire Game, Storytelling

name: Just Waffle
description:
In Just Waffle, you want to grab the treat that awaits on the table precisely fifteen steps away from the door. Walk too far, though, and the shop owner punishes you for intruding.

At the start of each of the eight rounds, each player has a hand of three cards and one of the treats is placed next to the deck as a reward. On a turn you play a card from your hand, then draw a replacement card. If you play a number, you add that number to any total previously announced as all players are walking to the table together; if you play a card with an effect, you carry out the effect.

If you make the total equal fifteen, you grab the treat and the round ends. If you go higher than fifteen, then the total stays the same and you receive a penalty marker.

Whoever has the highest score after eight rounds wins!

name: Nikimak
description:
Chaos and destruction have overwhelmed every place and soon the entire planet will end up into the hands of criminals and outlaws. Everybody has only one hope: the future... (And a bit of luck!!)
To win, find your wisest and most skillful friends and repel the insidious and destructive insects from your headquarters.
Good luck commander...

A smart combination of strategy, mind-reading and risk-taking, inspired by the card game “Rat a Tat Cat” with a lot more tweaks in gameplay and 2 wooden dice!

At the beginning of the game, players have little information about their cards, but further on, this information is not only about their cards, but also about the opponents' cards!

—description from the publisher

name: FLIKKEN het bordspel
description:
Solve a mysterious case at home in this intriguing board game, based on the popular Dutch TV series. Flikken is a dice rolling game where players solve a difficult case, while at the same time working to keep criminality under control and prevent the collapse of the city. Roll the dice, collect police tokens and place your forces in different zones to increase your control over the city. By controlling more zones in the city, players receive information about the mysterious case.
Can you keep the streets safe and solve the case?

FLIKKEN is played with 2 to 4 players and takes about 45 minutes to play. The game mostly contains luck and a bit of strategy.

—description from the publisher

name: Roll & Seek: The Museum
description:
Roll & Seek is a twist on the classic game of Memory.

Lay out the museum tiles face down in a grid to create the floor plan of the museum. Take the two picture dice in hand and roll them. The dice will reveal the two locations in the museum where you will find your friends hiding. Flip two tiles to see if you've found them - if the tiles match the dice, you win the game.

If the tiles and dice don't match, just flip them back down and let your friends Roll & Seek.

The game also includes four special tiles with extra rules on them, for players that want to take their Roll & Seek game to the next level.

name: Jr. Rangerland Camp Scramble
description: Roll the die and be the first player to set up your campsite. Watch out because your opponents can swipe your cards - but so can you! Each card includes fun campfire jokes.

name: 4 Letter Words
description:
4 Letter Words is the fun, strategic card game in which you connect cards, as you try to create the most words, and score the most points, possible!

How To Play
Select a player to keep score for each participant, as the game progresses, buy use of a writing instrument and a piece of paper. Next, shuffle the deck, deal each player 5 cards, and set it face down. Draw 1 card and place it face-up in the centre of the playing area. The player left of the dealer has the first turn.

For each turn, a player may place any card held on an open side of any card on the playing surface that create a 4 letter word, in a grid that expands in any direction, which scores the player points on the card played. If multiple words are created by the play, the card's score is multiplied by the number of words made. Thereafter, the player may play additional card, up to all 5 held at the beginning of the turn. The total score earned on all cards played is multiplied by the number of cards played, as a bonus. All cards played during a turn must be linked by at least one side. All words created must be found on the "4 Letter Word List" card.

To end a turn, the player draws cards to replenish his or her hand to a total of 5. If a player is unable to play even a single card, the turn is forfeited. Play continues clockwise until all cards have been placed.

The player with the highest score wins!

name: Trivial Pursuit: The Golden Girls
description: The Golden Girls Trivial Pursuit bite-size edition contains 600 questions based on all seven seasons of the Emmy Award-winning TV series.

name: Meine ersten Spiele: Beim Kinderarzt
description:
At Dr. Liebherz's office, there is never a dull moment: Linus has come for his vaccination, Greta has had an accident, and Emma has a cough.

In Meine ersten Spiele: Beim Kinderarzt the players help the doctor to make her little patients feel better. In free play, the players familiarize themselves with the instruments. The actual game has simple rules requiring a good memory because the players are now allowed to help treat the patients. And in the interactive game narrative, they can experience a fascinating day at the doctor's office.

—description from the publisher

name: T-Rex
description:
The dinosaurs are out! Now we need true dinosaur experts who don't lose track of things during their turbulent search.

In T-Rex, the two dice decide which dinosaur is sought. Which player will find the correct matching dinosaur and can hold onto it and protect it during the game?

—description from the publisher

name: Trapwords: The ultimate word strategy game
description:
“The next dimension in word gaming”

TrapWords is easy to play yet complex to master. Earn points by forming words in all directions: straight lines, staggered, reversed or turned upside down. Only those who excel at splitting or closing word “traps” will emerge victorious.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Tile Placement

name: Monopoly: Marvel 80 Years
description: Gameplay inspired by the Marvel Universe and iconic Marvel artwork including art by Alex Ross. Properties include Covers, Marvel Knights, and Team Leaders, and instead of houses and hotels, this edition features Issues and Omnibuses.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Crypto Swintus
description:
In today’s feverish turmoil of new currencies, corporate magnates force usually layabout hogs to work tirelessly on cryptofields, digging for different kinds of oinkoins until they are blue in their snouts. But true Swintus can overcome any hardships. All you need is simply to squander away the whole capital entrusted to you and be the first to leave on vacation. Your glorious business venture will become a legend among all lazybones of neighboring (crypto)farms.

To win the game you must be the first player to get rid of all of your cards. Winner scores an amount of points equal to number of all cards in their opponents’ hands at the end of the game. We recommend to play a series of games, up to a certain number of points, depending on the number of players. First player to get certain amount of points will be the winner of the series.

name: Charge Stations: A Science Fiction Roll + Write War Game for 1 Player
description:
"Commander’s Log - Solardate 11.12.30
Due to an unforeseen systems malfunction, while passing through an anomaly, our warp drive has lost all power. Additionally, it has managed to power down all of our weapons systems onboard the U.S.S. Frontiersman. Usually, such a malfunction would be little more than a minor setback. It may even prove a useful piece of scientific and engineering research as the crew works on solving the problem and figuring out why the anomaly effects out ship in the first place.

However, things seem a bit more dire for us at the moment. The anomaly was right on the outer reaches of Kornathian space and we’ve been set adrift near one of their war parties. They have no desire to stop and discuss the situation or work out terms of peaceful negotiation. Instead, they have opened fire upon us.

I, as the commanding officer of this ship, can not simply let this be. I have men and women aboard I need to protect. As such, we will continue to work on fixing the warp drive and powering up our weapons, all the while we will fight off these unwanted attacks. It seems our choices are either to get the warp drive back up and running, so we can light jump out of here, or defeat the capital ship that is leading the war party against us."

Charge Stations! is a science fiction roll+write game where a single player takes command of the U.S.S. Frontiersman. It is up to the player to repair the ship all while fighting off incoming attacks. This is done by rolling handfuls of six-sided dice (D6s) which represent the ship’s crew members and assigning them to various tasks around the ship. All you need to play is a pencil, some dice, and this book.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Deadly Desserts
description:
Deadly Desserts is a trick-taking card game. If you've never played a trick-taking game before, Deadly Desserts is the perfect game to start with! The game is played in a series of tricks, in which players play one card each. The winner of each trick takes the cards, most of which deal damage. Thus, your objective is to avoid winning tricks! It's a very fun gameplay style because you win by not winning.

If you're familiar with trick-taking games, Deadly Desserts builds off of classics (e.g. Hearts, Euchre, Bridge) and adds exciting gameplay features, such as Gourmayhem Cards to double cards' values or being able to play 2-10 players rather than 3-4.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game

name: MAST BUY
description:
MAST BUY is an auction game where the players are athletes in a yacht race and must purchase the masts they will use.

The "masts" in the game consist of a set of small wooden dowels between 120mm and 160mm in 5 mm increments, with multiple of each size. Each player starts the game with 50 money, marked on a board, a random mast, and a blue stone.

On a turn, a player chooses a mast, blindly, from the game box to put up for auction. The auction proceeds around the table with each player making a pass or bidding and the last player to place a bid winning the mast.

The game ends when a player has won a certain number of masts, four of the same size, or is out of money.

If a player has collected four of the same size, they immediately win. Otherwise, players earn points for the number of masts they have in sequential size order (5 mm apart), with duplicates of a size adding no additional points. Players also earn points for money that they did not spend. The player with the most points wins.

name: Brothers' War 1983: East Germany VS. West Germany
description: An wargame on hypothetical battle between East Germany and West Germany in 1983. The second game of Kilovolt Design's "Mini War" series.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Pocket-Escape: Schlagabtausch
description:
Carl Mac Sweeney's former boxing coach Eddie is in trouble:
He owes the syndicate money. A lot of money. In desperation, he turns to Carl and asks him a favor - because Eddie knows where to get something...

28 pages full of puzzles, action and difficult decisions are waiting for you. Pocket Escape: The exchange of blows fits in every pocket - the ideal case for at home or in your luggage!

name: ウリニゲセブン (Sell Out Seven)
description: As a miserly store owner, you want to provide the least amount of sausage in your hot dog buns as possible while still displaying the most enticing hot dog in the market. After all, you don't want to be left with unsold product. By using clay as the bread and different lengths of wire as the sausage, you will design five different hot dogs for your store, some of which may not even have a sausage at all! Then your fellow store owners will snake draft the sausages from other stores that they find enticing. At the end of four choices for everyone, the contents of the hot dogs are revealed. Those owners who held back or had the most unsold sausage lose points, and finally the positive points from everyone else's sausages are added up. Beware the very short sausages: those are great decoys, but worthless for scoring!

name: DKT Smart
description: This version of an old classic makes use of an app that offers different game modi and minigames to give you a chance to break out of jail or win more money.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Investment, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Carrera de Mente: Cartas
description:
A card version of the classic trivia game Carrera de Mente.

On this version players throw a coloured die to get a subject and then answer one of the questions on the card (according to the die result). If you get it correct, you can keep the card and get a new turn.

First player to score 10 cards wins.

name: Neuroshima Hex! 3.0: Futboliści
description:
During the Polish Open Championship, which took place during Portalcon (22nd January 2022), you could win the brand new Footballers mini-add-on, which contains three unique tiles.

Before the start of the game, each player may place uncovered Futbolist tiles next to their army tile stack*. Each player may place a maximum of: 1 Linebacker, 1 Defender, and 1 Attacker. If, during the game, all 3 tiles a player draws are Instant Action tiles, he may use the Player Substitution rule. If he chooses to do so, he discards one of his drawn tiles and takes 1 of any of his Football Player tiles (placed next to the pile) in its place. He then continues his turn. During the course of the game, a player may make as many Player Substitutions as he has Football Player tiles. If a Football Player tile is removed from the board, it goes to the discard pile of the player who placed it on the board. If more than one player uses Futbolists during a game, each player marks the Futbolist he plays with a spare HQ damage token.
You can still use the Unlucky Draw rule when playing with Futbolists.


Note: You cannot use Futbolists while playing Factions: Dancer, Mephisto, Death Breath.



Przed rozpoczęciem rozgrywki, każdy gracz może umieścić odkryte żetony Futbolistów obok stosu żetonów swojej Frakcji*. Każdy gracz może umieścić maksymalnie: 1 Liniowego, 1 Obrońcę i 1 Atakującego. Jeżeli podczas rozgrywki wszystkie 3 żetony, które dociągnie gracz, będą żetonami Natychmiastowymi, może skorzystać z zasady Podmiany Zawodnika. Jeżeli się na nią zdecyduje, odrzuca jeden z dobranych żetonów, a w jego miejsce bierze 1 dowolny ze swoich żetonów Futbolistów (umieszczony obok stosu). Następnie kontynuuje swoją turę. W trakcie gry, gracz może dokonać tyle Podmian Zawodników, ile żetonów Futbolistów posiada. Jeżeli żeton Futbolisty zostaje usunięty z planszy, trafia na stos odrzuconych żetonów tego gracza, który wcześniej go na tej planszy umieścił. Jeżeli więcej niż jeden gracz korzysta z Futbolistów w czasie rozgrywki, każdy oznacza Futbolistę, którego zagrywa, zapasowym znacznikiem Wytrzymałości Sztabu.
Grając z Futbolistami wciąż można korzystać z zasady Pechowego Dociągu.


Uwaga: Nie można korzystać z Futbolistów podczas gry Frakcjami: Dancer, Mephisto, Death Breath.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Front Line: Stalingrad
description:
At the end of August the Sixth Army and the Fourth Panzer Army reached the banks of the Don, Hitler ordered them to capture Stalingrad by surrounding it from the north and south with rapid movements of the tanks. Stalin and his lieutenant, General Zhukov, reacted and sent the 62nd and 64th Armies to defend the city.

This is a Roll And Write mechanics game for one player with a minimum duration of 20 minutes.

Completing 70 German kills, ends the game and the player wins the game. The Germans (AI) must capture some sectors depending on the difficulty to win.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Unnecessary Inventions
description:
This is the reason your mom always told you to pay attention in school! Unnecessary Inventions, a game inspired by the hit social media sensation, challenges players to come up with creative, innovative ( and ridiculous) solutions to common , everyday problems ( that most people don't really care about). Be the player with the most invention cards at the end of game play to win the top spot. Happy Inventing!!

GET CREATIVE: Unnecessary Inventions is a card game that turns players into their own inventors and brings out everyone's creativity, while getting friends & family together for a fun game night or gathering.

HOW TO PLAY: Draw an invention card and read it aloud to all players. Then flip over the 2-minute timer and start inventing! Solve the Invention-Time problem, coming up with your own invention’s name, description, and a drawing of the invention.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX?! Each game comes with everything needed for over 70 rounds of fun: 74 invention time cards, 6 dry-erase pens, 6 dry-erase boards, and a 2 minute sand timer.

name: Wingspan: Grus Japonensis Promo Card
description:
This Promo comes with the 1st edition of Wingspan's Chinese edition.
Represented the Chinese national bird, the red-crowned crane (Grus japonensis).

Illustration by 沈銓(Shen Quan) in Autumn 1757.
Shen Quan is known as the most famous painter of the red-crowned crane in Chinese Qing Dynasty.

Card information
Name:　　丹頂鶴(Red-crowned crane)
Scientific name:　　Grus japonensis
Habitat:　　Wetland
Food:　　Invertebrate + Seed + Fish
Point value:　　7
Nest type:　　Ground
Eggs:　　1
Wingspan:　　235cm
Power: WHEN PLAYED:　　Draw 3 bonus cards, keep one, and discard the other two.
Flavor text:　　在東亞地區的文化中，丹頂鶴象徵著幸福、吉祥、長壽和忠貞。然而這並未能讓它們擺脫瀕臨滅絕的殘酷命運。(In East Asian cultures, the red-crowned crane symbolizes happiness, auspiciousness, longevity and loyalty. However, this did not save them from the cruel fate of near extinction.)

name: Адмирал: эпоха парусных сражений (Admiral: Era of Sailing Battles)
description:
Real sea battles
Admiral is a board game with the sea, sailboats, clear and very cool mechanics, a pirate addition and paintings by Aivazovsky. A great example of how an incredibly addictive board game turns out from a small number of details, which can be played both together and four, or you can even combine two boxes and play with a large crowd. The game has basic and complicated rules, scenarios and a pirate add-on.

Detailed study of the movements and combat actions of the ships, of course. Everything is simple: for each turn you have two cards common to everyone: the number of possible moves in different wind directions, and the state of the sea (when the wind is weak, ships can generally drift, and when strong, accelerate several times). The goal of the game — almost like in checkers — is to knock out all opponents from the field. There are guns and boarding for this!

As in a classic naval battle, ships from one successful shot do not sink, but lose their mast. The larger the ship, the more guns it can shoot, attacking or defending. Moreover, in order to shoot, you need to stand sideways to the enemy, and in order to board, go to his cage and press side to side, like real ships. But boarding allows you not only to injure or sink an enemy ship, but also to capture it by transferring your mast to it! (Remember that only your ships must remain on the field to win?)

Logical repair rules
You can return the ship to your fortress to restore its masts instead of moving forward. But a fortress cannon is spent on each mast, which means that if an enemy sailboat approaches from the side of the fortress, where there are no more guns, he will be able to attack the fortress! Well, strategists and tacticians, are you ready for sea adventures?
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Smile Life Apocalypse
description:
The end is near. Resist crises. Arm yourself. Fight. Face your opponents. The hour of the Apocalypse has come. The time has come to take up arms.

Smile Life Apocalypse offers many new features for even more interactions, surprises and fun! The new mechanics bring a multitude of unexplored possibilities to the game. Always with as much humor and second degree.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Guru Guru
description: A variant of Halma. Each player has their pieces on their back row and you win by getting all your pieces to the opposite side of the board. On your turn you move a piece to a neighboring space in either of the eight directions, or jump over a single piece in a straight line.

name: いただきさしあげパンケーキ (Itadaki Sashiage Pancake)
description:
"Itadakisashiage Pancake" is a delicious trick-taking game where you can get a lot of delicious-looking pancake towers with fruits and whipped cream, eat and give pancakes, and get hooked.

Each player takes out one card in order multiple times, and when the hand is used up, the points are totaled and one round ends.

Whoever has the most points after four rounds wins.

name: Dark Souls: The Board Game – The Sunless City Core Set
description:
The Sunless City was the shining jewel of Lordran, where sacred spires and legions of knights were bathed in perpetual golden light. An illusion hides the deceit of an empty throne, blinding the lonely spirits to the truth of their forsaken city, and their bleak existence in the ashes of a dead kingdom.

Within these ruins, a co-operative journey of survival and heroism will unfold...for those prepared to die.

In Dark Souls: The Board Game – The Sunless City Core Set, you can become the Herald, Pyromancer, or Warrior as you navigate the haunted ruins of The Sunless City. Your ultimate challenge? A brutal battle against the formidable Dragon Slayer Ornstein and the fearsome Executioner Smough.

But success in this perilous realm hinges on one vital element: teamwork. Co-operate with your fellow Unkindled as you venture into locales once bathed in golden light, now lost to shadows. Your enemies are dangerous, their attack patterns and weaknesses waiting to be uncovered.

Alas, death is not the end — but the price of failure is high. Should one of your characters meet their demise, the game presses on, but with a heavy price. The entire party must return to the bonfire, each encounter resetting, and the odds growing ever more challenging.
categories: Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Video Game Theme

name: Master Debaters: Smosh Edition
description:
Here, at Master Debaters, we want you to debate the most pressing issues facing our country. We need answers to things like: Is a spork more spoon or more fork, are full denim outfits acceptable, and who would win in a fight between my dad and your dad? Battle head to head with your friends in front of a judge and jury to settle these, and other extremely important issues once and for all!

Straight from the internet's most popular comedy brand, this SMOSH Edition comes jam-packed with extra helpings of extraordinary and bizarre debate topics bound to get you and your friends into a game of sticky situations.

Master Debaters SMOSH edition is designed for players 12 and up, will have you arguing over crazy topics with your friends. Don't worry, because a judge and jury will help settle extremely important issues like "what's more salady: fruit salad or potato salad. The object of the game is to collect the most Master Debater cards by winning debates over your opponents. Each player is given a number card and a jury sheet. Each debate will have a judge, two debaters, and the rest of the players in the round become the jury. The judge chooses the debaters by picking numbers chosen by each player, The judge then reads the question and the debaters flip the chip to see whether they will argue point 1 or 2 on the topic card Each debater is given time for an opening statement, and then the opening argument begins. The timings can be 30 seconds or 10 seconds. The judge has final call on who wins and can override the jury decision.

—user summary

name: Mister Mailman Junior
description:
from the publisher:

The mail must go through! On foot, by bike or by taxi, travel the neighbourhood streets to be the first mailman to deliver all of your 24 letters to their destination! With your family and friends, take part in this thrilling race which is sure to fill you with excitement!
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: GameBrotherZ, Pierre Belvédère, Scandinavian Trend Company

name: UNO Remix
description:
UNO Remix features familiar UNO gameplay, with players trying to empty their hand by playing cards that match the value or color of the topmost discard play, but now you can personalize the deck to make it your own and change what's possible during the game.

At the start of each round, you add special cards or write-on cards to the deck. You can personalize cards to specific players, e.g., "Skip to Aldie" or "Draw 2 Chad", you can add a mark to a card to increase the number of cards drawn the next time it's played, you can introduce cards that block penalty cards, and much more!

And as always, when you have only one card left in hand, you must yell "UNO!" to warn others that you're about to win.
mechanics: Hand Management, Legacy Game, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Roma Invicta?
description:
Roma Invicta? is a simulation game about the first two years of Hannibal's campaign in Italy (218-216 BC). The Carthaginians have three armies and the Romans four, the strengths of which are tallied in a chart off the map to save having a lot of counters. These armies are manouvered around the 17 regions of the map of Italy in a simple I go - You go framework, undertaking different actions including ravaging (for the Carthaginians) and combat.

The combat rules are straightforward and simple with a few interesting tweaks such as ambushes. In many cases conflict is restricted to skirmishing between the forces but chance may cause a larger battle to occur. The Romans have to strike a balance between not risking having their armies utterly destroyed in battle by the wily Hannibal whilst not allowing the empire to become demoralised if the Carthaginians are allowed to ravage the land unimpeded.

The game, given to Society of Ancients members as part of their subscription in 2008, consists of a 20 page A4 rule-book with colour covers, a simple but adequate map and 36 counters which you need to cut out yourself.

name: Una Que Pensamos Todes
description:
Naivety and ingenuity are shared.

Una Que Pensamos Todes is a game of associations. A game that proposes to discover the corners of our minds that we share with the rest. Once per round, a person will turn over a card from the Context Deck and a card from the Trigger deck at the same time. Each player will then have one minute to think or write down a concept or idea that associates both cards. After the minute we will see how many people put the same thing as us and that will be our score. After ten rounds, whoever has scored the most points will be the person who wins.

name: Pin Point
description:
Pin Point is an abstract strategy game for 2-4 players which is played on a black plastic board with a 10x10 grid. The playing pieces are 100 capsules with a colour on one end and black on the other end. (25 each of green, orange, purple and red).

The aim of the game is to place your pieces on the board so that they create scoring configurations of lines, squares or crosses in one of the four colours.

name: Monopoly: Harley-Davidson Motorcycles
description: In this edition of Monopoly you get to cruise the game board on a vintage 1903 Harley, or a Softail® Deuce™ - there are 8 pewter game tokens customized just for Harley fans! On your ride, acquire all the Harley-related properties that you can. Once you've got 'em, buy garages to house them, or even whole dealerships where you'll show them off. When opponents "stop in"; charge them big bucks to "look around"; Includes custom Harley money, Chance and Community Chest cards, dice and a game board loaded with photos.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Zip! The Fastest Dice Game in the Universe!
description: Zip your way to the winner's circle! Shake 'em, Roll 'em, Move 'em!!! The faster you roll 'em, the faster you win. Roll your dice, keep any aside and re-roll the rest. Be the first to roll the correct combination and move. Zip is the fastest dice game in the universe. Ages 8 and up
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Stimmvieh: Ihr habt die Wahl!
description:
Stimmvieh is a game for party secretaries about collecting the largest donations for your party. However, votes are also valuable, as the two players who have collected the most and second most votes in the end may double their donations. Everyone starts with an equally powerful team of politicians. However, you already have to decide whether you're hunting for votes or donations when you nominate your top candidates.

This is a revised edition of Stimmvieh with 90 cards instead of 115.

Major differences as compared to the 1998 version:

The new game plays with 3-4, not 3-5.
The game was newly balanced
3 and 4 players use the same deck of cards
New 3-player-variant
Cards come in larger size
Production was crowdfunded


you can win by either only collecting donations or by collecting the second most votes (and enough donations). In few games the player with the most votes actually wins the game.

With three players a dummy called "Angelus" plays with you. You take turns in helping her play. What is more, she can also win the game.

name: Emojito Party!
description:
Emojito Party! provides big emotions in a practical travel format. As in the classic game EMOJITO!, players have to express emotions that are specified on the game cards: the bored, arrogant cat, the nasty fish or the frenetic, overwound alarm clock. You think that's easy? Then play Emojito Party and find out how well you are able to realize and recognize emotions. You can play Emojito Party! as an independent game, or add its cards as a complement to the classic party game EMOJITO!. Give your emotions free rein!

—description by the publisher

name: Buntbär & Co.
description: A children's card game that can be played at various levels of difficulty to suit player's skill levels, starting with age 3 and going up. The object of the game is to collect cards with the appropriate colors to complete Buntbär the bear's festive raiment. The title is a bit of a pun as "buntbar" means colorful while "Buntbär" would sort of mean color-bear. Actually, not just bears, but 12 different animals are featured. The animals are sad because all of the colors have been pinched. Collecting cards is their way of finding them again.

name: Police Party
description:
Party game where players bet on the answers given by their opponents, knowing that the questions are: forensic science, investigative techniques, TV series, the cons-intelligence, unusual facts, amazing stories etc.

Players take the role of the police, all suspected of being dirty cops! Which will prove that he is not the one?

Each player gets question. Then they bet with their set of cards for opponents who is guilty or who gets points.
After that they answer the questions.
If the answer is incoorect he gets all the points wagered by the opponents. If the answer is correct the opponents get the points they give.

The goal is to have the fewest points at the end of five turns.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Trivia

name: Fußball-Fieber
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Germany, Spain, or perhaps the outsider, Costa Rica? In Fußball-Fieber, each player chooses a team and tries to lead it through the group stage of the World Cup. Through the use of action cards, a player can both control the game play of his own matches and cause trouble in games between other players. This promises exciting duels that never turn out the same way.

Each player chooses one of the 32 teams from the 2014 World Cup, and leads it through the group phase of the World Cup. With the help of action/reaction cards, each player can try to control the result of his own matches, and also cause trouble for the other players.

And for those players who manage to qualify, a knock-out phase with quarter-finals, semi-finals and the great final awaits them.

Players have to manage a hand of cards to maximize their result over the 3 group matches. Each card can be played on any team: his own, his opponent, but also any team from the other matches. For the knock-out phase, players get a new hand for those 3 new matches.

The winner ? There can be only one: the last team standing, winner of the final and WORLD CHAMPION.

name: Ghostbusters: The Board Game II – Peoplebusters Pack
description:
Introduced in The Real Ghostbusters cartoon, the Peoplebusters come from a universe where Ghosts are everywhere and humans are the ones who are the pesky threats. This Exclusive add-on expansion includes new variant rules, 4 Peoplebusters figures, and 4 double-sided cards with their Ghost form on one side and their character stats on the other. They can be either a Class-3 Ghost or a playable character. This CZE-Exclusive pack also includes 4 double-sided map tiles featuring Boo York and Boo York Courtrooms.

INTRODUCING A NEW WAY TO BUST! Player-versus-Player Variant is a part of the pack!

This add-on pack also includes a special rules variant for Player-versus-Player (PvP) gameplay and 8 PVP cards! In this variant, one player/team takes control of the Ghostbusters, while the other player/team controls the Peoplebusters.

When the Ghostbusters and Peoplebusters collide, it’ll be a battle for the ages, and it’s up to you and your friends to determine who wins!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management

name: 8 Bit Attack: Happy Halloween
description:
Extra ghoolish heroes and monsters to make your 8-Bit Attack adventure even better! Happy Halloween is the only PG exclusive on this Kickstarter!

The Happy Halloween expansion adds 8 new heroes based on classic movie monsters, 5 new enemies, plus a new final boss - none other than Count Dracula himself!

name: UK Cynical Edition (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
from Dave Millard’s website:
This expansion was created by a small group of game playing friends namely Jay, Alex & Ubbie. It is meant as a bit of fun and is in no way endorsed by Days Of Wonder, any Railway Company or the UK Government.

After playing Dave Millard’s great UK expansion we collectively decided that it played very well but lacked a certain modern Britishness. The Ticket To Ride games exemplify an idealised 19th century railway system, not the crud we have today. In the UK news a week can barely pass without some train problem or transport minister making an arse of himself. So we decided to put our not so serious heads on and invent an expansion to Dave’s unofficial map to bring back those elements we miss from our modern railway system.

Warning, if you have no sense of humour and have no idea of the calamities we have on our railway network you may just not get it!

Some example card:

Incompetent Contractors: Tunnel built where not needed. Treat route as having 1 tunnel (can be used to counter "Competenc Contractors" instead)
Pending General Election: Suddenly money can be found to counter any problem. Cancel any other card played on you.
Government Meddling: Remove a route placed by an opponent and replace route with your own (you must have the cards to build the route)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play, Trains, Transportation, Travel
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: 1500 Gold
description:
The theme of the game is running, and takes place in three stages. Each player tries to manage their three racers through training, qualifying, and then during the finals.

Each runner has three different qualities..

During training you roll dice and choose a pawn to advance, trying to land on beneficial squares and avoid landing on detrimental squares. The goal of this stage is to get tactic cards to help you win the qualifying race and the big final race.

In the qualifying rounds you roll dice and play cards in an attempt to get one of your better players, with more tactics cards qualified for the final. You are always guaranteed a place in the finals even if you fail to qualify (you get in on a 'technicality'). If that happens though you get no cards and no special abilities.

The finals is a more detailed race - with a race track, blocking, sprinting, and so forth.

name: 5 sekund edycja specjalna
description:
In this version, questions are prepared by players.
It seems easy to mention three uses for your tongue - but can you do it in 5 seconds when you just mess up your tongue? The rest of the players are watching you, waiting impatiently for your response, and time is running out! Just throw it away!

name: Faces in the Crowd
description: The game board has four sections, each of a different color. In each section are interlocking rings that have colors which match the sections of the board. The first player places a round token (with a drawing of a face on it) on a ring in any section. The next player must then place a token on a ring in the section that matches the color of the ring that the first player placed his token on. Tokens may not overlap, so when a token is placed, the rings that interlock with that ring are unusable. If a player cannot play a token in the required board section, he takes all of the tokens that have been placed in that section and now must try to place them as well. The first player to have no more tokens to place wins.

name: Monster in My Pocket Board Game
description:
Another in the "Spinner" category, the game includes: a colorful mounted mapboard; 4 Soft Plastic "Special Monsters"; 48 cardboard "Monster" cards; the "Spinner"; and the Rules.
The mapboard depicts 4 "Arenas" of combat-Ice Caves, Volcano Pit, the SWAMP, New York City, & the center starting place. There are special spots on the board such as Force Field, Transporter, and each "Arena" has one spot directing the player to ANOTHER "Arena". The players lay out the "Monster" cards randomly onto the game's spaces. Then they move around and "Battle" the Monsters they land on and if successful, claim that Monster's Card. Each card has strengths and weaknesses depending on where that card is located in one of the "Arenas". The player with the MOST cards, once the last one is battled for, is the winner. The Spinner could also make a player GAIN or LOSE a card to another player.
There are many more NEON color Monsters that were sold in separate sets and collecting them all should be even MORE fun for the lil ones. I first started getting the sets for my Nephews and THEN discovered this game for THEM! There are some truly bizarre figures such as the JOTUN Troll, which has 10 or more heads, the VISIBLE invisible man (EVERYONE should have THAT one!), HANIVER-looks just like a GIANT Gremlins disembodied Head, Spring Heeled Jack (maybe DISCO version?), MANTICORE-Man's Head w/multiFANGS-Lion's forepaws-Eagle haunch-Scorpion/Pincer tail, Baby YAGA (what? no TEEN angst ridden type?), TRITON-MerMAN, COCKATRICE-Griffin like with Snake body, BIGFOOT! the BEAST...& Great BEAST, lots of your well known garden variety MONSTERs &...RED CAP(?)-I bet HE turns out to be bright...NEON...GREEN! LOTS of FUN for EVERYONE! WHOA!...I believe THIS predates PoKeMoN, them copyright infringement...so & sos!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Fighting

name: Frames
description:
Frames is played by two players on a Go board with its pieces, and a few neutral pieces. It can also be played with pencil and paper, because once placed, the pieces can not be moved. The moves are simultaneous. In each turn, both players place one of their pieces in an intersection of the board. If the intersection chosen by both players is the same, a neutral piece is placed instead. Otherwise, both pieces just placed define a rectangle of intersections on the board. The player who has more pieces inside that rectangle (the pieces in the borders of the rectangle are not counted) earns a point. The first player to earn a total of ten points is the winner.

Online Play


Super Duper Games

name: Tschu-Tschu
description:
Two small locomotives are having a competition.
The turn signal decides what will happen:
Will one of the locomotives move on?
Will the position of the gate change?
Or will the little bell start ringing?
Whoever is the first to get back to his/her own railway station wins the game.
A first handling and pushing game for 1 - 2 very young players.
It is impossible to lose any of the parts, since they are fixed to the wooden game board.

Ages 2 and up

name: So ein Eiertanz!
description: So ein Eiertanz!is a simple card laying game, where players have to place eggs and worms in line of sight of their chicken, in order to gain points. Various special cards (scrambled eggs, lakes,...) can be used to either destroy eggs of the opponents or block line of sight. More cards included in the set (e.g. easter eggs) can be added to the basic card set for more interesting options during gameplay.

name: Rodeo Rummy
description:
Rodeo Rummy features the "card deck" dice from Square Shooters in a new take on traditional rummy games. At the start of a player's turn, she spins to find out which type of rummy hand she needs to roll on the dice, with an additional bonus or penalty coming from the inner ring of the spinner. You could earn an extra roll, be penalized for hearts or spades, earn double points for jokers, and more.

Once you have your target, you have at most three rolls of the dice to make it and earn points.

Rodeo Rummy includes instructions for other rummy variations that can be played with the Square Shooters dice.

name: Only Fools and Horses Trotters Trading Game
description:
This game is based on the BBC TV comedy series "Only Fools and Horses".

The goal of the game is to become a millionaire buy doing some dodgy deals around Peckam and then going to the Casino to win your fortune. You need a minimum bid of a "monkey" (500 quid). Be the first to win a "million".

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – High Yield Photon Torpedoes Resource
description: High Yield Photon Torpedoes are a participation prize given to players who participated in Month 3, "Endgame," of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Storyline Organized Play Event, Resistance is Futile. It is considered a Resource, and costs 5 Squadron Points.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Ninja All-Stars: Benkei
description: Devotion to duty is a hallmark of many on Kagejima. For Benkei, devotion to duty is a defining characteristic. While his martial skill serves him well, it is his utter devotion to the Moon Throne that imparts his famous resilience and fearlessness. They say that the gods could not move Benkei when he takes a stand in the Princess’s name.
publishers: Heidelberger Spieleverlag, Ninja Division, Soda Pop Miniatures, Ulisses Spiele

name: Blanc-Manger Coco: La Pilule
description: La Pilule is the third expansion for Blanc Manger Coco. It contains 41 question cards and 159 answer cards.

name: Ninja All-Stars: Karura
description:
Description from the publisher:

Karura is a Clan Tanchyo-themed Hero for Ninja All-Stars. Heroes bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. Each Hero is themed to a single clan and make must-have additions for players who pick up the clan box.

Karura is unusual among even his rare, adventurous clansmen, for he feels a greater kinship with the Tanchyo’s cousins—the eagles—than with any human he has met. Although seemingly distant, Karura possess a great inquisitive nature that has led him to tinker endlessly and invent many wonderful things. His latest invention—a contraption of snares, wires, pulleys, and hooks—allows him to fly between trees, cliffs, and rooftops with all the grace and speed of his beloved avian cousins.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Fierce Flying Human Ninja Master
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Sports, Video Game Theme

name: Spin it!
description:
Let’s go on a thrilling ride in Spin it! The spring fair is underway in the city, and everyone's standing in line for the wildest ride of all. The cars fly about so quickly that the animals dare to ride it only with their very best friends. Who will be the first to get all their animals on the crazy car ride?

In more detail, spin the arrow on the disc, lay a card next to a matching animal, use the action symbols, and play all of your cards to win.
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Monopoly Space
description:
The Earth is so yesterday that it is time to conquer the whole universe!

In this astro-themed version of Monopoly, players travel around in space to buy planets, mine resources, and build their colony. The resources are used to build the domes that make up the colony. The players have to move fast before the other players take the glory. The first player to complete their space colony and get back to GO (the Earth) wins.

name: Family Feud Blockbuster Movie Edition
description:
FAST-PACED FUN: Family Feud Blockbuster Game is an exciting, fast-paced game for everyone 12+. Teams take turns trying to guess the most popular answers to 200 survey questions about film!
MOVIES, MOVIES AND MORE MOVIES: Can you name a former TV star who became an A-lister? How about naming a movie with a made-up language? Brush up on your movie smarts because there are hundreds of survey questions waiting for your answers.
PLAY FACE OFF AND FAST MONEY ROUNDS: Just like on the show, you’ll compete in two categories. Play three Face Off rounds before you try the Fast Money round where everything can change with a simple answer!
QUICK START, FUN AND ENGAGING: Just take the game out of the box, set up the components, choose your teams and get ready to play! For 3 or more players, ages 12 and up.
Includes: 150 Face Off Cards, 50 Fast Money Cards, 1 Dry Erase Scoreboard, 1 Dry Erase Marker, Instructions
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Glücksgriff
description:
The game is a strategic card game. With the help of various tactics and special rules, you have to try to reduce the total number of points of your hand cards faster than the other players, in order to find out in the last turn whether you have fewer points than the others. From round to round, points are accumulated until a set limit is reached, deciding victory or defeat.

At the beginning, all players receive 7 cards, the rest are placed on the draw pile and one card is placed face up on the discard pile. The object of the game is to reduce the value of the cards in your hand to less than 7 points by clever discarding. Once this is achieved, that player can shout GLÜCKSGRIFF and the round is completed. The player who now has the fewest points wins.

name: Live Laugh Lose
description:
Get ready for Live Laugh Lose, the adult party game where you compete to make your friends laugh using only the world's corniest jokes. Delivery cards get you to tell bad jokes with funny deliveries. For example, you may have to read the following joke in a Siri voice: "The person who invented knock-knock jokes should get a no-bell prize." Your team scores if you get the opposing team to laugh! Bad jokes have never been funnier.

Adults Only: This game contains mature content and is designed for ages 17+. It is not intended for children. Trust us on this one. Encouraged to be played with 2+ players.

Each player starts every round with 3 Joke
Cards and 1 Delivery Card in hand. Before a new round, draw fresh cards and put the old ones in a "used" pile.
Players take turns trying to make the opposing players laugh by reciting 1 of the 3 Joke Cards in their hands.
After the joke is told, the 5-second "Quiet Period" begins. The joke teller counts down on their fingers. The opposing players must not laugh during the "Quiet Period" in order to win the point. If they laugh, the joke teller wins the point. If the opponents don't laugh, they each get a point.
The first person to get 11 points wins the game!

name: Klostermust
description:
Klostermust is a family game, or light weight strategy game with both luck and a lot of tactics. Klostermust uses dice and action drafting as its core mechanics.

The game takes place in a monastery, where you play as monks and nuns who compete to collect apples and make soft apple cider. The goal of the game is to impress the bishop who will visit the monastery on the seventh day and mark the end of the game.
To be successful you need a fair bit of tactics but also a bit of luck.

The game is published in Sweden.
mechanics: Action Drafting, Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Take That

name: Daemon Trilogy: Subrosa
description:
Daemon Trilogy: Subrosa is a card-drafting skirmish game in which players compete to fulfill contracts and gain the most influence in the Empire.

This title is the first in a series of app-enhanced, campaign-style card games. Subrosa takes you along the story of power, control, and double-dealings in a battle of supremacy between the five great houses. Recruit mercenaries from your hand to take on and fulfill contracts. These contracts collect you influence and (perhaps eventually) control of the Empire. Team up with allies for mutual protection or stealthily egg on your opponent's quarrel. How to win is up to you, but remember to keep your enemies close, and your friends even closer.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Stranger Things Adventures Together
description:
It is a cooperative game in which you have to try to solve mysteries and defeat monsters. Each turn you have to choose where you move your character and acquire resource or combat enemies.

—user summary


The compelling series Stranger Things has just become an exciting cooperative card game! Will Mike, Dustin, Will and their chums manage to defeat the monsters from the Upside Down?
Players can take on the roles of the famous characters from the series and team up to free Hawkins from the monsters of the Upside Down, revisiting scenes, places and enemies from the Netflix saga.
Each player has their own individual talents, but everyone is united in a shared mission - to unravel the mystery surrounding Eleven and to release Hawkins from the evil presence that grips it.
The game includes: character cards, monster cards, place cards for both the Upside Down and Hawkins, and special place cards for each season of the series.
There are also Eleven cards for averting danger and instrument cards for special powers as well as mystery cards!


—description from the publisher

name: How to Host a Murder: Maiming of the Shrew
description:
THE MAIMING OF THE SHREW

My dearest fellows:

When frosty winter shall besiege thy brow, come ye, my friends, to Twelfth Night at the Glib. Such revelry the gods may still allow for foodstuffs sticking tightly to the rib. Her Royal Highness Queen Illicibeth shall with her presence deign us at our spree. With recipes of our Lady MacDeth, O verily what foods these morsels be!

My lovely lady Katheter DeVane doth with me host our heavenly soiree. Her beauty driveth many men insane, but only I could steal her heart away. So join us at our genuine behest and take the blade of revelry to breast!

In Her Majesty's Service
- William Sheepsheare

CHARACTERS
Queen Illicibeth, Lady MacDeth, Mary, Queen of Schnapps, Ophelia Bottomsworth, Spamlet, Prince of Hallmarke, Caliban Rollon, Gridlock, the Merchant of Tennis, Costello the Abbot

name: Thaxx
description:
From the Publisher's website:
"THAXX features a solid oak ship's plank, authentic replicas of the Elcazador's Lost Treasure and a historical game in which you attempt to plunder the loot of your opponent. The game of Thaxx seems as though it was ripped from the deck of the great ship and into your hands. Thaxx is easy to learn with fast paced game play for ages 6 and up."

On your turn, you roll the dice. You either add a coin to the number on the board that is the sum of the dice or add two coins to the respective numbers. (e.g., if you roll a 2 and a 3, you could place a coin on the two and a coin on the three, or place a coin on the five)
You may also use one of the numbers to remove one from your opponent's board and place it on your own. (e.g, take from your opponent's 3 and put it on your two).
There are no sixes, sixes do nothing. In fact, rolling double sixes requires you to remove one of your own coins. Otherwise, rolling doubles allows you to go again.
The first to cover all his/her numbers wins.

name: It's Good to Be the King
description:
(from publisher's website)

It's good to be the king. When you rule the land by divine right, none may question your authority and you may do as you will. You possess absolute power, giving your whim the force of law and drawing the people of the realm into your majestic presence as ants are drawn to sweet, pure honey. Unfortunately, you are not the king. You are one of the ants.

The object of It’s Good to Be the King is currying the most favor with the king by providing the most important elements for a series of events to honor him. During the course of each game, the king demands that seven events be held for his pleasure. These include such diversions as parades, hunts, feasts, and tourneys.

In order to do the royal bidding, players manage their hands in order to collect the things necessary to satisfy the king’s demands while preventing the other players from doing the same. Use care when getting rid of your cards, since what is useless for the Tourney may be vital for an upcoming Feast! The player who has the most royal favor at the end of the seventh round of play is the winner.

Each set includes a Court Deck of 80 cards, a Chartulary Deck of 10 cards, and an instruction sheet. It’s Good to Be the King is suited for 3-6 players who do not mind backstabbing their opponents. This fast and fun game of court intrigue and chicanery will be on store shelves this June, so round up some friends and prepare to be royally entertained!

name: Liar's Poker
description:
Similar to the same game as played with serial numbers on paper money in bars. Each of the 55 cards has 8 single digit numbers. Each player has one card and players make bids based on how many of a given digit they believe exist in total on all the cards in play. "2" is the lowest digit, "0" is considered a ten, and "1" is an Ace which is higher than a ten.

The starting player makes a bid such as "Three fours" and each successive player must make a bid with the same quantity of a higher digit, or a larger quantity of a lower digit, or challenge. Once all but one player has challenged, all cards are revealed and the digits bid by the last bidding player are counted. If the bid is made all players pay that player, if lost then that player pays all the others.

name: Happy Chickens
description:
When the henhouse is assemble and the sticks are inserted, then let the 5 chicks fall through the hole in the roof.
At the start of your turn, turn over a counter and if a colour appears (red, blue, green or yellow), remove a stick from a hole of the corresponding color:

If the dark chick falls you can turn over another counter and carry out the action again.
If one or more of the chicks fall when removing the stick, you can keep them. The turn passes to the next player.
If the chicken appears when turning over the counter, you must return one of your chicks to the henhouse.


The game ends when there are no more sticks in the henhouse. The player with the most chicks wins.

name: Build!
description:
In Build! You have to play the role of a pitiless businessman who wants to build up as many construction projects as he can, regardless of their nature and without caring about the damages they can deliver to the environment and to public health. To achieve your goal, you can use different kinds of Cards: Land Cards, on which you can build up constructions; Construction Cards, representing the different buildings you can put on your land; Actions Cards (Attack & Defense), which have the objective of damaging the enemy and/or defending yourself from enemy attacks; Catastrophes, which are terrible events that could happen and damage all the players in the game (Eg. Earthquakes, Volcanic Eruptions, etc.)
All the card illustrations are very funny, the rules are easy and the playtime is about 15-20 minutes, but you can add some strategy to the game, using all the rules included in the game, so that playing time is increased to 30 minutes.
The game box includes two card decks, (each of 55 cards) and the rules.
The size of the card is 8,7 x 6,3 cm.
The game is designed for 2-8 people.

name: Cités nouvelles
description: Cités nouvelles/Wohnprojekt 88 is a trick taking board game played with tiles. A series of hands are played, with each player trying to collect one type of building (bungalows, houses, apartment buildings, and high rises). After the hand, players who collected the type of building they specified place the tiles they collected on the board, scoring points.

name: Wikinger Bande
description:
Savana (in English language Savannah) is a fast, simple, family card game.
Each player is a Savannah animal. Each animal has its unique power. Each card represents one of the four animals in the game with a number value.
Every turn players discard two cards to form four piles (one per each animal) or they discard a card into a secret 5th pile.
When the secret pile contains 3 cards, these cards are revealed and put into the other four piles. The pile with the highest total value of cards grants his possessor 1 victory point.
The game ends when one of the player plays a special "end" card.

name: History of the Second World War: Part 2 – The Overrunning of the West
description:
The Overrunning of the West was the second installment of The History of the Second World War series. Part 2 covers the battles for Western Europe through 1941. Scenarios include: The Overrunning of Poland, The Overrunning of Norway, The Overrunning of the West, The Battle of Britain, The Overrunning of the Balkans and Crete, and a campaign game.

Part 2: The Overrunning of the West was a complete game in itself. It had all the rules and components necessary to play any of the scenarios of Part 2 (except dice), but was designed to be played with The History of the Second World War - Part 1: Hitler Turns Against Russia. Units are Fleets and Armies. Game scale is approximately 175 miles(280 kilometers) per hex.

name: Història Màgica de Catalunya
description:
[EN]: A simple fantasy-medieval game in which the player must travel around Western Mediterranean cities (specially Catalan ones) with the ultimate aim of dueling with and defeating a mythological dragon. During the travel, the player gets cards in each city he passes, and these cards drive the game, as they contain events, missions, travels and so on, which can improve the player's powers until he or she is ready to fight the dragon.

---

[CA]: Un joc simple de temàtica fantàstica-medieval, en què el jugador ha de viatjar per diverses ciutats de la Mediterrània occidental (especialment catalanes) amb l'objectiu final de lluitar i véncer un drac mitològic. Durant el viatge el jugador rep cartes a cada ciutat per la qual passa i aquestes cartes dirigeixen el joc, ja que contenen esdeveniments, missions que cal complir, viatges, etc. i permeten millorar les característiques del jugador fins que està llest per lluitar amb el drac.

---

[ES]: Un sencillo juego de tema fantástico-medieval, en el cual el jugador tiene que viajar por diversas ciudades del Mediterráneo occidental (especialmente catalanas) con el objetivo final de luchar y derrotar a un dragón mitológico. Durante el viaje el jugador recibe cartas en cada ciudad por la que pasa y estas cartas dirigen el juego porque contienen eventos, misiones que hay que cumplir, viajes, etc. y permiten mejorar las características del jugador hasta que está listo para luchar contra el dragón.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: World Cup
description:
User Summary:

In World Cup players each manage tennis players, trying to optimally deploy them in order win tournaments and earn money by marketing the results. The game ends after the sixth tournament, and the manager with the most money wins.

Before each tournament there is a travel phase where the managers simply move their two players (one amateur, one professional) to the next city by rolling the dice, possibly resolving events on the way. When a player reaches a city you can decide in which of the four quarter finals to place him, provided the tournament isn't already full.

When all players have arrived at the location the tournament begins. The winner of each match is determined through the best of 5 sets. A set is won when a players manages to roll a 6 (professional players have two on their dice, amateurs only one). The winners of a match advance to the next stage which is resolved in the same manner.

After the final match, the four best players receive prize money according to the prize table and can also collect one marketing contract each. Those can be cashed in after a tournament to obtain additional money, either individually or in matching sets while sets are much more valuable.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Brautkraut
description:
German has the tongue-twister "Blaukraut bleibt Blaukraut und Brautkleid bleibt Brautkleid", which translates as "Red cabbage remains red cabbage, and a bridal gown remains a bridal gown". The game Brautkraut takes this tongue twister to the extremes as each of the game's 66 cards depicts two of the following four items:


Blau (blue)
Kraut (cabbage)
Braut (bride)
Kleid (gown)


There is one pile, on which players place cards from their draw decks. On a turn, the active player has to say aloud, what was on the now covered card, and the one, the previous player just put on top of this. After having said this, he reveals one card from his/her draw deck and covers the top card.
You have to check the arrow on each card telling you the order of the parts of the word, which have to combined into a compound noun, and if the next one is the same or not. When ist is the same, the player has to say "bleibt" (remains), when the new word is different, he has to say "wird" (changes into) between the nouns.
For example, a player might say "Brautkraut wird Blaukleid" and pöaces his topmost card onto the "Blaukleid" card. The next player has to start now with "Blaukleid", continuing with the now visible card ...

Additional confusion comes from three extra cards that circulate between the players and change the linking word from "wird" into the similar sounding trio of "traut" (weds), "klaut" (steals), or "braut" (brews).

If a player makes a mistake, she must take all cards played since the previous mistake. Whoever gets rid of all her cards first wins.

name: Buddy Hop
description: Join the SimplyFun Buddies for a hoppin’ good time! Buddy Hop features two games in one! Game one concentrates on building your child’s memory and sequencing skills, while game two concentrates on building quick visual association skills. The durable, soft foam character mats are great for indoor and outdoor play.

name: Crazy Letters
description:
This fast-paced word game will strengthen quick-thinking skills and leave everyone wondering which way is up! Players roll the die to determine a category (such as "Games & Hobbies" or "In the Kitchen") and then draw a card.
