It's the Fast-Dealing Property Trading Game featuring Disney Princess! In this edition of the Monopoly game, each player chooses to play as an adventurous Disney Princess character. Then they build up their magical kingdoms by traveling around the board and buying properties along the way. Kids can buy up spaces like Mulan's Shan-Yu School, Jasmine's Magic Carpet Ride, Merida's Archery Lessons, and other Disney Princess properties. When all properties are bought, the player with the most owned properties wins! If there is a tie, then the player with most money will take the crown!

Includes gameboard, 4 Disney Princess tokens, 64 cardboard Princess markers (16 for each), 8 cardboard special tokens, 16 Chance cards, money pack, 2 dice, and game guide.


Disney Princess edition of the Monopoly game
Play as a favorite Disney Princess character
Buy up Disney Princess properties
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Shocktato
description:
Shocktato: the Shocking Potato Game. Pass the Shocktato around the group, but don't be left holding the Shocktato at the end!

Move the Game Mode Selector Switch to the position that says Extreme. This mode is for true Shocktato players. This mode got its name because it has no music, just a surprise buzzer and emits a shock. Now press the start button. In Extreme Mode, it will beep to let you know it is active but will play no music. Begin passing the Shocktato around the circle. Be quick though, when the buzzer sounds, the shock begins. The player who is left holding the Shocktato when it shocks must leave the game. The last player in the circle is the winner.

Move the Game Mode Selector Switch to the position that says Normal. Now press the start button. In Normal Mode, you will hear music begin to play. Begin passing the Shocktato around the circle. Be quick though, when the music stops, Shocktato emits a shock. The player who is left holding the Shocktato when it shocks must leave the game. The last player in the circle is the winner.

Move the Game Mode Selector Switch to the position that says Lame. This mode is for the weak at heart. This mode got its name because it does not shock. Now press the start button. In Lame Mode, you will hear music begin to play. Begin passing the Shocktato around the circle. Be quick though, when the music stops, the Shocktato makes a buzzing sound. The player who is left holding the Shocktato at the buzzer must leave the game. The last player in the circle is the winner.

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Playroom
description:
Let’s put in order the highest number of toys exactly recalling where they have been placed.

Place the chest of drawers on the table. Place the 6 toy tiles facedown in front of the drawers. Take a set of 12 shoe tiles.
The current player takes a tile from the toy table, showing it to all, and puts it into any of the drawers. The turn passes to the next player, who will do likewise with the constraint of storing the card in the drawer below the previous one. The last two toy tiles stay on the table and will be considered as they were put on the floor.
Shuffle toy cards and assemble a card deck. Turn over all the cards, one at a time. All together the players should try to remember where to find that toy: place on the card a shoe tile with the colour of the drawer or with floor face up.

Now check the actual position of the toys: did you recall where all toys have been placed? You won!

name: Reverse Charades:  The Classic Game
description:
Classic charades game in a tin.

Split your group into 2 teams. Each team selects a guesser (everyone gets a turn guessing) and the rest of the teams acts out the:

- Action
- Song
- TV Show
- Film
- Landmark
- Event
- Book

Use the timer provided to get through as many charades within the two minutes as possible. Teams take it in turns to act, the non acting team must keep score of how many correct answers the guesser obtains. After every person on both teams has guessed the winner is the team with the most correct guesses/points.

Not a peep among the team members acting. You lose a point if you speak or "mouth" any words to each other or the guesser.

Use of objects (or even people) is definitely permitted. You may use generic charades actions, but remember you're against the clock so you may prefer to dive straight in...

Ready, Set, Go!

Source: Game instructions.

name: Aqualiens
description:
Aqualiens is a fun boardgame for kids, in which players use special transparent cards to complete the tasks, and help the adorable creatures collect as many seashells as they can.

Meet the aqualiens - creatures that live on the bottom of a deep blue ocean. They really like seashells and, as everyone knows, you can never have too many seashells! They have learned to grow new arms and tentacles, so they can always grab just one more shell. Help them transform correctly, and collect as may sea treasures as they can carry.

In the Aqualiens board game each player receives one of the four cute aliens. Transparent cards and goal cards are placed in the center of the table, so everyone can reach them. Lay the transparent cards with arms and tentacles on top of your alien card to complete the task, but make sure to use as few cards as possible! The quickest player to grow and collect everything that's needed, according to the goal card, wins a victory crystal.

When the players are already good in playing with basic rules, they can try to make the game more complex, by adding some extra rules. In addition to arms and tentacles, the players have to collect a certain amount of seashells on the card of their alien. Note that if some player stops the round by saying "I'm ready!", and it turns out that the task is made incorrectly, then the player loses one victory crystal! The first player who receives 5 victory crystals wins the game.
publishers: Lifestyle Boardgames Ltd, Red Cat Games

name: Twilight of the Gods: Elder Gods
description:
Kickstarter exclusive Deity cards for Twilight of the Gods. This is a set of six Outer Gods and Great Old Ones from the Cthulhu Mythos to add to your games as substitutes for mythological gods.

The set includes Cthulhu, Nyarlathotep, Azathoth, Dagon, Shub-Niggurath and Yog-Sothoth.

It was packaged separately from the base game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Moutown
description:
Moutown is a family game based on communication between players.
You will need to look at other players and react quickly to win.
Each player owns two sheepfold, each on is shared with one of the neighbor.
You will need to choose quickly the best ships in the pile while taking into account the the choices made by your neighbors.
—user summary

MOU­TOWN est un jeu fami­lial doux et mol­le­tonné qui vous tien­dra chaud l’hi­ver. Toute l’ori­gi­na­lité du jeu réside dans un savant mélange de com­mu­ni­ca­tion entre les joueurs, de rapi­dité et d’ob­ser­va­tion. Rem­plis­sez vos Ber­ge­ries avec les meilleurs mou­tons, avant les joueurs adverses mais pre­nez garde aux Loups !

—description from the publisher

name: Ocracoke
description:
海賊の宝島 ～オクラコーク～ is a trick taking game. The goal is to collect the most treasure in multiple rounds.

There are 36 cards in 4 suits, each with 9 cards from 1 to 5. Some cards will have a treasure with them. Each player will have 4 rum tokens at the beginning. Each player is dealt 4 cards. During each trick, players have to follow the lead suit. In case a player cannot follow, he draws a card and place it face down in front of him, which he will take it into his hand. (A playerr can also intentionally pass to draw one more card.) Otherwise, the player who plays the highest card wins the trick. He places the collected treasures (on the card) in front of himself. In case of a tie, the card with skull wins the trick.

When a player empties his hand, he escapes. When two players escape, the round ends. If a player escapes without collecting 3 treasures, he is punished for being a coward. He turns over a rum token to chicken token. If a player escapes with 3 or more treasures, he get a score equal to the number of collected treasure. For other players who cannot escape, they will be caught by the navy and lost a life (rum token).

The game ends when (i) a player has over 15 scores, or (ii) all players lost their last life. In case (i), the winner is who collected more treasures. In case (ii), everyone loses.

—user summary

name: Das verrückte Spinnenspringen
description:
Goal of the game:
Snap as much spiders as you can into the web before the time is running out.

Game mode:
Together count down from three and let your spiders jump! The oldest player then quickly turn the hourglass around. When the first player shot all of his or hers spiders into the web he or she shouts "Spinnen-Springen-Stop", the round is finished. If the hour glass has run through and nobody got all of his or hers spiders into the web, then the player with the most spiders in the web wins. One game has five rounds. Whoever wins most of these rounds is crowned spiderking!

—user summary

name: Adrift: Lost at Sea
description:
Adrift: Lost at Sea is a challenging, 2 - 4 player, cooperative card game that focuses on bringing people together. It’s like the Oregon Trail meets a 16th Century shipwreck - As you make the journey back home on the unforgiving tides, your table becomes the lifeboat and you become the survivors. Plus, at the end of the game, you'll get a unique sea shanty about your voyage to sing (or chant) together and reminisce about your adventure!

On this journey home, you'll endure storms, navigate the seas, balance and repair your tiny lifeboat, fish for sustenance, and work together to help each other survive!

Players try to complete all cards in the route home deck while outlasting storms and maladies to win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Army Group South
description:
"DAMOS: Army Group South" is game 3 of the Barbarossa trilogy of wargames that can be combined together as a mini-monster. Each game by itself is a straight forward operational simulation of each theater, and all 3 games share the exact same rules allowing for easy integration. Units are divisions for the Germans and Division to Army sized for the Russians.

DAMOS is a brand new, unique take on operational scale WW22 combat. With almost 0 player downtime, DAMOS is highly interactive between possible reactions, combat postures, and other mechanics. DAMOS takes many well-known wargaming conventions and repackages them into an all-new take on the most familiar conflict in wargaming that force long-time grognards to rethink their normal instincts.

Army Group South covers Von Rundstedt’s extended trek towards the Caucasus. AGS had the largest theater of operations and the highest expectations placed upon them compared to the other Army groups. While assisted by the Hungarian and Romanian armies, the best executed armored breakthroughs only went so far once the fuel trucks could not keep up with the Panzers.

WEIGHT: 6/10

SOLITAIRE: 6/10

PLAYERS: 1-2, up to 6 players with AGN and AGC.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Zone of Control

name: Freunde versenken
description: Freunde versenken is a game like Battleship. Instead of ships you are firing on the names of your friends. Every player uses a DIN A5 paper to manage his own battleground and the battleground of the other player. It comes with an anti-cheat-shield.

name: Interval Initiate
description:
In Interval Initiate, players clash in 3 epic rounds of Note playing and Interval claiming! At the start of each round, each player drafts an Initiate card and draws Note cards equal to the combined health of all the Initiates on their team.
During each round, players take turns placing Note cards to either the left or right Notes stacks. Be the fastest to SLAP the correct Interval card that matches the interval between the Note cards to claim it! Beware, slapping the wrong Interval causes you to lose Notes! The player with the most intervals at the end of 3 rounds wins!

—description from the publisher

name: More or Less
description:
More or less (styled as <=>) is a short and compact trick-taking game for two players. The player to win the last trick, wins the game.

Every trick has its own challenge, determined by the 4 square board. Both players play their cards simultaneously. Depending on whether the Challenger wins the trick, the next trick will have a new challenge.

An easy to learn, but hard to master micro game in a very distinctive 1980s era CGA-style.

-description from designer
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Math, Video Game Theme

name: Squishmallows Take4
description: Your mission is to gather 4 cards from the same Squishmallows Squad. But watch out—if you try to grab the same one as another player, you both have to race to grab the mini Benny The Bigfoot in the center in order to claim the card.

name: Crazy Mixed Up Zoo
description:
This one will challenge even the sharpest elephant! In Crazy Mixed Up Zoo, animals are switched and turned all around to confuse the players. Can you guess which pair of animals has traded places? Prove you have the memory of an elephant and win the game!

Ages 4+

name: Five Stones
description:
Five Stones is an ancient game played in various forms in most countries throughout the world. The rules vary slightly but typically they involve 5 to 10 stones or tokens of some type.

The modern game of Jacks, using metal caltrops and a ball, is a descendant of this game. Unlike Jacks, Five Stones games require only pebbles or tokens.

The game may also have been played with astragals, or sheep knuckle bones, but instead of being used as randomizers for wagering they're used in place of stones for tossing.

Five Stones requires only a handful of small stones, although many variants use stylized tokens instead of stones. The stones or tokens normally have irregular or cubic sides to allow scattering in a small area.

In Korea 5 small octagonal prisms or polyhedrons are used, in the traditional Jewish variant 5 cubes are used, but the only real requirement is 5 irregularly-shaped pebbles.

Typically the game involves casting the stones and then tossing one stone in the air and picking up another and catching the first before it strikes the ground. In some regional variants the stones are caught on the back of the hand, either for scoring or during play.

Related to: Knucklebones
Re-implemented by: Jacks

name: Subbuteo Urban Arena
description:
From the publishers website:

Subbuteo Urban Arena is fast paced, 5-a-side football at its best. Customise your arena and show off with outrageous tricks using players from Europe's finest clubs.

name: Master of Pizza
description:
You've just received three orders for pizza, so it's time to gather the required toppings and deliver the largest and most delicious pizzas possible. If you outperform the other would-be pizza chefs, you will be Master of Pizza!

The card deck in this trick-taking game consists of 40 topping cards (five types of toppings valued 0-7 in each type) and 15 order cards (five each of small, medium and large pizzas, which use three, four or five toppings, respectively). At the start of the game, each player receives one order card of each size.

Master of Pizza lasts 3-5 rounds. In a round, each player starts with 8-10 topping cards in hand; thus, each round consists of 8-10 tricks. The lead player in a trick plays one topping card to the table, then each player follows, with no requirement to follow suit. The highest card in the suit led wins the trick, and the person who played that card collects the topping cards one-by-one, placing those cards in separate stacks by topping type on the table in front of him, with the most recently played (and collected) cards on top.

At the end of the round, each player decides whether to score for one of his order cards in hand. For each topping shown on the order card, the player scores only the topmost topping card, scoring zero points if that topping is missing. The player then discards the order card.

The game ends after five rounds or at the end of a round in which at least one player has scored his third order card. The player with the most points wins.

name: Connect 4: Spin
description:
Grid-spinning, game-changing fun! A strategic game of weights and balances! Place your disc, then spin to line 'em up!

The classic game of Connect 4 returns with a new, tactical, kinetic variation. Each column spins separately, and the more checkers are added, the more likely it is that gravity will take over and spin the column upside down!

Place a disc anywhere in the grid and then spin that column. But spin strategically because lining up 4 in a row doesn't count unless the discs still line up after spinning. Each color set of discs contains one disc with extra weight. Players can use it at anytime for a strategic advantage. The first player to connect 4 discs horizontally, vertically, or diagonally wins the game

name: Medicine Whoops
description:
A game of hilarious medical disasters. Players each take on the role of doctors at a poorly supplied hospital. Doctors compete with each other to treat patients using whatever tools they are able to acquire. Players also have the ability to hinder their fellow doctors in the middle of surgery or just agree to play a round of golf while the patient expires. Patients will begin to stack up fast... both cured and killed. Add em up at the end to determine who among you is the best doctor under the worst conditions imaginable.

Players start with a handful of tools which they quickly put to use when the first patient is revealed. Once the patient is flipped doctors must quickly determine if they can attempt the surgery using the tools they have in their hand.

During surgery other doctors can attempt to hinder the procedure by playing whoops cards which can increase the cost of surgery or steal tools or patients right out from under you.

The length of the game is variable depending on how many patients you want to attempt to treat. This is determined at the beginning of the game. After the last patient has been cured or killed the game is over and doctors count up their living patients subtract the ones in the morgue and arrive at a final score.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Simulation, Take That

name: Paintcheck: The Paintball Game
description:
From the Publisher...

From rookies to pros! Lead your team to the highest level of competition through the experience acquisition system and the championship rules. Personalize your players by increasing their skills and make their performances more realistic: The Avanced Rules book offers some great extra rules (snapshooting, communication, crawling....) to go deeper into paintball excellence.

Box Contents
A full-color folding board figuring a paintball field.

56 finely sculpted plastic miniatures :
30 players designed in 3 different positions.
21 "Sup'Airball" obstacles.
1 prebunkering template.
An illustrated rules book, with examples and playing tips.
Colorfull cardstock counters.
2 Dice.
A transparent shooting ruler.
2 summary table cardboards.
A "breakout" sheet pad.
30 "jersey number" stickers for the models.

name: Eyes of the Jungle
description:
From the box:

Trouble is stirring in the jungle. Village children have disappeared ... Temples robbed ... Rare Animals captured... A call for help reaches our hidden camp. We slip into the Dark and Dangerous Interior. Our mission is to protect and save. We are the eyes and ears of the jungle. We are the Jungle Rangers. Skill and cleverness will be needed to make the rescues and return alive. Imaginations will be challenged because we must use whatever resources we find to overcome the Deadly Dangers. But our very best resource is ourselves, working as a team, eyes and ears for each other. Careful thinking, bold imagination and cooperative team work are encouraged. Tricky strategies entice adults as well. Different adventure each time... Take great care, amigos!

name: The Prestel Art Game
description:
A trivia and party game focused on art.

Goal
Collecting 8 chips in 6 different colours by answering questions or completing tasks.

Game play
Each player gets a little palette which he/she has to fill with coloured chips. Players take turns rolling the die. The active player moves the red pawn on the board and has to answer a question or complete a task, depending on the space the pawn lands on.

Tasks include:

Answering a question from the card
True or false? (cards contain statements about artists, techniques or the history of art, and the active player has to guess whether it is true or false)
Brainstorming (players have to write down 3 things they associate with a picture)
Have fun with art (terms have to be drawn or described verbally while the other players guess)
Auction: The active player turns over number cards, trying to get as close to 21 as possible without going over 21.


Correct answers and successfully completed tasks earn the active player a colour chip. He/she can also lose colour chips during the "auction" activity.

The game ends when a player has collected all 8 required colour chips. That player wins the game.

name: Monopoly: Garfield
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

This is the Garfield Edition of Monopoly which celebrates Garfield 25th Anniversary
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Pirates of the Caribbean Trilogy Edition
description:
Yo ho, it’s a pirate’s life for YOU as buy, sell and trade key haunts and pirate hangouts from all three Pirates of the Caribbean movies: Curse of the Black Pearl, Dead Man’s Chest and At World’s End. The adventure continues as your favorite scurvy pirates return to battle and vie for ultimate control of the high seas in this Pirates of the Caribbean Trilogy Edition of the world’s most popular board game, MONOPOLY. Set sail for exotic ports and infamous locales, including Rumrunner’s Isle, Tia Dalma’s Shack and the Chamber of the Brethren Court. The fate of the seven seas lies in your hands now, matey. Do you have what it takes to outwit, outlast and outplay the legendary Pirates of the Caribbean? Argh, properly warned, ye be, says I.

Six collectible pewter tokens include Jack’s Shrunken Head, Davy Jones’ Heart, Flying Dutchman Cannon, Davy Jones’ Dice Cup, Jack Sparrow’s Hat and Davy Jones’ Locket.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation, Pirates
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: dibdib
description:
Dibdib is a party game for 3-6 players. This game includes two cloth bags, round wooden discs and cardboard heart markers. Each player takes two heart markers. The wooden discs are put into one of the bags and the other bag is left empty.

The first player reaches into the bag with the discs and grabs any number of discs and places them into the second bag. The first player then offers both bags to one of the other players. The second player then has a choice. Either take both bags or take only the second bag. If the second player takes both bags, that player will repeat the steps that the first player took. If the second player takes only the second bag, then the contents of both bags are revealed. The first player counts the discs in the first bag and the second player counts the discs in the second bag. The person with the most discs wins. The loser flips one of his heart markers to the broken-hearted side.

This process is repeated until a player has turned both of his heart tokens to the broken-hearted side.

name: Five Crowns Mini Round
description:
Five Crowns Mini Round is a five-suited rummy-style card game that's a smaller version of Five Crowns with fewer cards, although the fifth suit of stars and a rotating wild card are still present.

Your goal is to combine all of your cards into sets and runs, be the first to go out, then watch the others scramble as they get one last chance to cut their losses. With each round, the number of cards dealt increases and the wild card changes keep players on their toes.

name: Wetthüpfen
description:
Four funny ball frogs are hopping around like world champions. Will luck be on their side as they make lap after lap? For each lap completed, players get to turn over a petal of their own water lily! Which Turbohopper will win the race? WOW! As if by magic, the flowers open for the frogs as they finish.

—description from the publisher

name: Nuke: The Last Game on Earth
description:
(From the Box)

World Powers battle for control of the world using forces that include modern day tactical and nuclear weapons. But watch out! Launch too many missiles and the Earth is plunged into a dark and cold Nuclear Winter!... No one wins.

Exciting strategies with thought-provoking results.

Includes beginner's rules (Easy to Play) and Advanced rules which include such variations as - EMP Effect and a "Doomsday" Time Limit.

Players command conventional armies, ocean fleets, intra and inter-continental weapons to make combinations of land, sea and airborne attacks. Players attempt to occupy the most territories and control the World's population, resources and technology.

However, launching NUKES destroys territories thereby reducing the relative value of the victory. Could you survive? Would you want to?

(From the writer) This game is like playing risk with nuclear weapons. Once one player goes nuclear, it's a "MAD" game (mutual assured destruction). The real value of the game is in showing that nobody wins in a nuclear exchange. Currently OOP as far as I know.

name: Four Sight
description: "A game of the future, where success is the power of Four Sight." Players alternate placing tiles on a 4x4 square board, each trying to complete their own pattern first. The pattern must be made out of three of their own tiles and one of the opponent's.

name: Chopper Chase
description: This game is from the Milton Bradley "Flipsiders" series. These were tiny games that looked like audio cassettes but actually folded out into miniature board games. In Chopper chase, the Bank Robber player wins if he moves his car across the board and lands on the Border space without being captured. The Policeman wins if he lands his helicopter on the Bank Robber's car (thus capturing him). Spinners are used for movement.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Junior Mix & Match
description: Mix & Match is a memory-type game where players must find matches among face-down cards or chips. The player who finds the most matches wins. .

name: Ombagi
description:
A 2-player abstract strategy game where the aim is to get your 12 pieces to the opposite side. They start and must finish in 4 stacks with a 'number 3' on top, a 'number 2' in the middle and a 'number 1' on the bottom (numbers are embossed on the pieces). The numbers determine the steps each piece must move and also indicate the highest level they may climb to and move at on top of other pieces.
Also comes with 4 other variants.
Chunky wooden pieces and a gold-printed imitation-leather board add a touch of class to this Frankh/Edition Perlhuhn production.

name: Unternehmung 25: V-Mail Postcard Game #2
description:
The second V-Mail Postcard Game, UNTERNEHMUNG 25, chronicles the Axis invasion of Yugoslavia in 1941. The basic game system is similar to the of its predecessor, Malaya. New elements include German mountain troops, Panzer Corps, air support, and the bombing of Belgrade, as well as the effects of mountain and river terrain. Hungarian and Italian troops also make an appearance.

Can you, as the Germans, make a lightning-fast assault and capture Belgrade in time to release units for the upcoming invasion of Russia? As the Yugoslavs, can you derail the German timetable and buy time for the Allies to react? It's all up to you.

18 counters at the Corps and Army level and a full-color map of Yugoslavia- all on a 5x8 inch postcard!

In a small series with Malaya: V-Mail Postcard Game #1.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: World Passport
description:
(Taken from the publisher's site):

The purpose of the game is to place the six pieces of the puzzle on the card so that a continuous path is formed by the clear parts from the starting point to the final point.

Each challenge contains a country map with 5 pieces of information about the country:

Country's flag
Country's currency
A general trivia fact about the country
Capital city
A famous landmark

name: Play that Tune
description:
Take a tune card and spin the spinner to see which tune you have to step out on the musical playmat for your team to guess.
If they guess right before the timer runs out, points are won and your team moves up the charts,
First team to reach number one wins the game.
Are you a musical master...
or a musical disaster?

name: Magnetic's Djeco Enchanted Fishing
description:
Found at http://www.craft4kids.co.uk

Djeco Enchanted Fishing is a beautiful wooden educational toy for younger children.

Magnetic fishing games have long been a traditional favourite toy for preschool children and are great for developing concentration and dexterity.

This wooden toy comes with 12 colourful fish, 2 magnet fishing rods, and an underwater scene box. Box dimensions are 28 by 15 by 2.5cms.

Makes an ideal gift for boys or girls aged 2 and up.

Summary Features

* Traditional childrens fishing game
* Beautifully designed
* 12 colourful wooden fish with magnets attached
* 2 wooden magnet fishing rods
* Lovely illustrated underwater scene box
* Box dimensions 28 by 15 by 2.5cms
* Part of Crafts4Kids wooden toy range"


Found a Greek Version at:http://www.tsironis.gr

"Επιτραπέζιο ψάρεμα με μαγνητικό καλάμι και ψάρια πού εξασκεί την παρατηρητικότητα και την λεπτή κίνηση του χεριού, από την Γαλλική εταιρία Djeco. "

name: Rabbit Hunt: farmcards ver 2.0
description:
Expansion set for Rabbit Hunt. It consists of a complete set of farm cards and bunny cards to offer an alternative to the cards provided in the original game. Some cards are the same as before, new cards include "take three carrots", "all players except you take 2 carrots", "play 2 farmlands", etc.
The set is supposed to be used instead of the original set, and not to be mixed with it. No reason is given.

name: Battledexx
description:
Battledexx is a card game inspired by the Final Fantasy 8 minigame Triple Triad. The game features anime-inspired artwork.

Players place cards to the grid in turn, comparing that card's statistics and abilities to all adjacent cards. The winner is the player with the most living characters after all the cards have been played.

Cards have a variety of abilities, both offensive and defensive. There are several types of magic, which resolve in a rock-paper-scissors sort of tree, as well as healing magic that revives defeated cards and summoning spells which bring an extra powerful card into play.
mechanics: Area Movement, Open Drafting, Role Playing

name: Tortuboom
description: Push the wooden turtle discs off the board by sliding the wooden crab pieces through the slit on the edge. The number of crab discs you get to use depends on what you roll on the die.

name: Uga-Uga Bufapum
description:
In prehistoric times, players strive to become the leader of their clan by being the most skillful farter, which they achieve when everyone else has passed out from the smells.

Uga-Uga Bufapum is a "take that" card game in which you play cards that either affect specific other players or the whole village. Players also might get the chance to eat meals to improve their farting abilities. The effect of each card is noted on it; aside from a "draw 2, play 2" rule, there seem to be few other rules in the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Black Stories: Fantasy Movies Edition
description: How could that have happened? Black Stories are fiddly, morbid and mysterious riddles for teenagers and adults. The players try to reconstruct the crime by asking, guessing and fiddling about. Only yes/no answers are allowed. A spooky card game just right for any party. This version of the black stories refers to Fantasy movies and Fantasy series Highlights.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game
publishers: Lex Games, moses. Verlag GmbH, Reflexshop

name: Jati
description:
A candidate for publication in the 3M Bookshelf Series, but never published in quantity. It is a very simple tile placement game. It is a 2 or 4 player game, the four player rules consisting simply in a tournament.

Only about 100 copies of this game were produced; they were all pre-production play test and reviewers' copies and most were subsequently destroyed. The first run had a 1965 copyright and a 10 X 10 playing surface; the second run has a 1966 copyright and a 9 x 10 playing surface.

Spielbox republished Jati in 1986.

Not to be confused with:
Jati, a dexterity game

name: Prank of the Fox
description:
Cards in Prank of the Fox (キツネのいたずら) have two faces: yours and your opponent's. Players choose roles as peasants or foxes. Each side scrambles for "OINARISAN". Peasants, your cards can be your card as long as nothing happens; foxes, you can "PRANK" on peasants' cards, calling and flipping their cards. When a card turned over, it becomes a foxes' hand! Let's read opponents' trick, and memorize their back! Let's outfox them!

•••

「キツネのいたずら」は手札のウラが相手の手札になっている表裏一体のカードゲームです。
プレイヤーは村人とキツネになり、「おいなりさん」をとりあいましょう。
村人がもっている手札は、なにもなければそのまま村人の手札として使えますが、
キツネが「いたずら」すると、なんとひっくり返ってキツネの手札として使われてしまうのです！
お互いのカードのウラを読み合い、ウラを覚えて相手のウラをかこう！

name: What Do You Meme?: The Office
description:
From Dunder Mifflin's Scranton branch and What Do You Meme? comes the best use of cardstock paper yet – introducing What Do You Meme? The Office Edition! Now you can meme your favorite characters and moments from the iconic show – Prison Mike, the Party Planning Committee, and Pretzel Day included, of course. Do this by using one of your dealt caption cards to caption the photo card in play. A rotating judge picks the winning combo each round! The Office marathon plus game night, anyone?

Includes: 300 caption cards, 75 photo cards, 1 easel for displaying photo cards and instructions

name: Freemarket
description:
Object: to make the most money by buying and selling cards with the other players. Cards come in sets, the more cards in a set you have the more valuable they are. Three cards are dealt face down to each player at the start, and each player is given $5000. The starting player draws a fourth card from the top of the deck and $500 from the bank, and then may attempt to make a deal to sell and unwanted card to another player. Haggling occurs. Each turn a player may only complete ONE deal.

The next player has their turn by drawing one card from the top of the deck and taking $500 from the bank and then attempting to make a deal... and so on until there are no cards left in the deck.

Collecting a set of three cards from the same group doubles the face value of each card. Collecting a set of four cards from the same group triples the face value of each card.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Powerpuff Girls
description: Another version of the classic board game Monopoly. This time you are taken to the city of Townsville to hang out with Buttercup, Blossom, Bubbles, Professor Utonium, The Mayor, and Mrs. Keane. The basic game rules are the same. What is different... well the look of the board and pieces reflect the Cartoon Network hit show, the Powerpuff Girls. Townsville dollars replace Monopoly money. Forces of evil and hotline cards replace chance and community chest cards. Townsville properties replace the usual deeds. In place of railroads there are Townsville landmarks. You can also use 3 villain characters with the special Powerpuff Girls optional rules.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Truchet
description:
Truchet is an abstract strategy game for two players based on a novel tiling of the plane with single type of two sided tile, which results in a variable pattern of rivers and islands which constitute the board. During play, tiles can be flipped which reconfigures the
connectivity of dark and light areas of the board. The standard board size is 7x7.

Each player starts with 12 stackable markers, which can either move along a river, join to form new stacks, or split stacks into multiple smaller pieces. Capturing is by direct replacement. The goal of the game is to capture all of the opponents pieces.

Online Play

Boardspace.net (real-time, AI option)
Gamerz.net (PBEM)

name: SticX Games: Anemone
description:
Populate the coral reef with your anemones and fill it with color. If you have more than anyone else at the end of the game, you’ll be the winner!

In Anemone, your goal is to have more anemones on the reef than anyone else.

On your turn, draw the top card of the deck and play it following the rules below.

All cards are composed of 3 different figures in all 3 possible colors.

Always play new cards partially or completely on top of the cards already at the center of the table (the reef):

If you place it partially (one or two sections of the card), you must match at least one color on the cards it is being placed upon.
If you place it completely, you must match two colors on the cards it is placed upon.


—description from the publisher

name: Franz von Frosch
description: Memory game in which players earn cards by feeding the third ball to each frog, while attempting to avoid overfeeding any frogs. The player with the most cards after three rounds wins.

name: スーパーバニーカンパニー (Super Bunny Company)
description:
スーパーバニーカンパニー (Super Bunny Company) is a card game from Japan.

The mad scientist Dr. Bunny Sikorsky has managed to transform every animal on Earth into a bunny girl. The world fell into chaos as the resourceful bunny girls fought for supremacy in what became known as the Entrepreneurial Warring States Period. In this hand management and tableau building game, play as the bunny president of a new company aiming to hire the best bunny girls and surpass all the competition.

On your turn, choose to either draw two cards or manage your workers. Hire one bunny per turn either as a free trainee or a full-time employee by discarding other bunnies whose colors match its cost. Promote as many trainees as you would like by paying their costs. Each of your workers gives you Bunny Points (BP) needed to win the game. When a player reaches 8 full-time employees, the game ends at the end of that round. The player with the most BP is the winner. Be careful though, as each trainee left unpromoted is worth -3 BP. Be fair to the trainees and pay their wages by the end of the game!
user summary

A virus spread by the mad scientist Dr. Bunny Skorsky has turned every animal on Earth into bunny girls. The world was thrown into turmoil along with the great decline of the civilization, but the bunny girls strived to revive the concept of 'company'. It is amazing, isn't it? You are the president of one such up-and-coming bunny girl company in fierce competition. Get busy recruiting and running your business to establish the largest company in the world!
This is a simple engine-building hand management game in which you discard the cards from your hand to pay the cost.

狂気の科学者バニースコルスキー博士がばら撒いたウィルスにより、地球上の動物はすべてバニーガールになってしまいました。世界は混乱に包まれ文明は大きく衰退しましたが、バニーガール達はそれなりに知恵を絞り『会社』の概念を復活させました。すごいね。あなたはそんな起業戦国時代に旗揚げした新進気鋭のバニー社長です。世界一の大企業目指して今日も採用と経営に奔走しましょう！
手札を捨ててコストを払うタイプのシンプルな拡大再生産ハンドマネジメントゲームです。
publisher's summary
categories: Animals, Card Game, Economic, Fantasy, Humor, Science Fiction
mechanics: Closed Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That

name: Beast Masters Duel: Sun and Stone
description:
In Beast Masters: Duel, a two-player shuffle building, tactical head to head game, players take on the roles of Beast Trainers. These trainers come from all ages and regions of Tymuria to compete for fame and glory in these seasonal tournaments. Beast Training used to be for protection from the creatures of the Great Divide, as those creatures became less frequent though, it became a sport. Only entered though by those whose bonds with their Beasts was unwavering. The Beasts themselves relished the idea of competing as a team, in a sport, rather than risking their lives.

Set 1 - As the next season begins, trainers are beginning to head to Mesa to compete. This Set contains both Valentina and Shaka, young rival trainers from the Mesa Region with opposite styles! Players may play the preset Valentina/Shaka Teams or draft their own from the 6 available Beasts in this set.

- description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Duel
description:
This is a two person card game. The components are a deck of cards with various fencing moves, a fencing strip board 8 squares long, and two fencing pawns, which are cardboard with wooden bases.

The game consists of players playing attacks and finding appropriate responses from hand to defend against them. Attacks can only be initiated by the "player at advantage", a game state that can be passed. The cards names and effects are all genuine fencing terms, from ballestra to fleche.

name: Spoof
description:
SPOOF is the classic game of BLUFF but with forfeits.

From the box:

"Everybody conceals a number of Spoofing disks in their hands and holds them out in a closed fist. Then you have to guess the total number of disks held out by all players.

It sounds straight forward enough but the other players will, quite naturally, be intent on stitching you up. Crafty bluffing and double guessing are the order of the day. You'll need to be sly, cunning and fiendishly sneaky to stay ahead.

Make the wrong decision and you'll have to take a dreaded forfeit card and face the consequences! You'll find yourself Sumo wrestling, eating dry biscuits off a plate on the floor without using you hands - or worse..."

Players hide between 0 and 3 disks within their hand and then take it in turns to try and guess the total number of disks held, taking it in turns to make the first call.

A player that guesses correctly is eliminated from the game and a new round starts. Play continues like this until there is only one player remaining. That player is the loser and spins the spinner on a penalty wheel to select a category of forfeit. The actual forfeit is determined from drawing from 5 different categories of cards.

name: Professor Noggin's Life in the Ocean
description: Part of Profesor Noggin's series of educational games to teach kids about their favorite subjects. The game contains 30 cards, each card has six questions, three easy and three hard. Players roll a special three-numbered die to select questions. The fronts of the cards feature colorful pictures of sea life.
publishers: Éditions Gladius International, Inc., Outset Media

name: Gold Broker: Y2K Collectors Edition
description: In this Monopoly-like game, players compete to be the first to double their net worth by rolling the dice and moving around a board buying properties and investing in gold. As in Monopoly, players have to pay each other rent when they land on owned properties, but this game focuses more on the fluctuating price of gold and takes advantage of the Y2K scare by including "Y2K Crash" spaces that cause money to be lost and "Computer Whiz" spaces where money is earned for fixing Y2K bugs.

name: Runaway Log
description:
"Look out below! There's a log on the loose, and it's heading straight for you! Which beaver will be lucky enough to steer clear of the log and reach the dam first? Join the Eager Beaver Squad: Blueberry Bill, Yahoo Yellow, Gang Way Green, and Redhead Red, and see who will outrun the runaway log."

The objective of Runaway Log is to be the first beaver to travel upstream and reach the dam first. The game is a roll and move with each player rolling two dice: a 1-6 die and one with a log graphic. You move the number of spaces indicated, and if a log comes up, you must pull the lever to loose the log down the board. It is held up above the playing pieces and has random magnets that may attach to a player's beaver and pull him back down to the beginning of the board where s/he must start again. There are leapfrog spaces that allow players to skip ahead on the track, and 'duck' spaces that allow a player to lay his/her beaver on its side to avoid the log.

name: Valpen Ville
description:
Help the lost puppy Ville back to the dog house. To succeed you'll need to find his leash, bone, food and water cup.

Contents:
1 game board
1 puppy
4 dog houses
16 item chits
1 spinner

name: White Mountain
description:
First game in a new series of simple wargames by TCS Games, it is a print & play on the first decisive battle of the 30 years war, fought 8th november 1620 on a hill near Prague. The Catholic League vanquished the Protestant/Bohemian army.
The game features a chit pull activation system, well tested on the similar ECW series by the same company, and a beer and pretzels feeling through the fast and furious battle.

It comes as a pdf with 2A4 map, 165 counters and 6 pages of rules.
Available through wargamesdownloads, arima and directly by the designer
categories: Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Wargame

name: 100 Wacky Things You Have to Do While Playing This Game
description:
The game is based around 96 Wacky cards - each with a wacky thing to do, a point value 1-12 and some with either 'Always' or 'Whenever' written on. There are also 4 prop cards and 4 props - funny glasses, a feather boa, an echo microphone and an elephant nose - with detailed instruction on what to do if you have one of these cards.

The 4 youngest players randomly pick a prop card then take that prop. Wacky cards are shuffled and placed facedown within reach of all. On your turn take a Wacky card, place it face up in front of you and read it aloud to all players. You then do the wacky thing - and if it's marked as an Always card you repeat it every turn; if it's marked as a Whenever card it will be whenever someone else does a particular thing.

The object is to be the player who gets the most points for doing wacky things over an agreed number of rounds. Add up the points on each player's cards - highest points wins.

name: Star Trek HeroClix: Tactics III
description:
Star Trek HeroClix: Tactics 3 puts you in command of starships from the Star Trek universe, including such factions as the Federation, Klingons, Romulans, Cardassians, the Dominion, Ferengi, and Vulcans. Tactics 3 adds four new factions: the Bajorans, the Kazon, Species 8472, and the Borg.

Tactics 1, 2, and 3 are intended as a standalone game system, 100% compatible with the HeroClix core rules system. So even though Tactics operates by the same rules and Powers and Abilities card that other HeroClix miniature games are played with, it exists outside of the Modern and Golden Age tournament environments and is played as its own game. (e.g., no Spiderman vs. USS Enterprise. There's Star Trek HeroClix: Away Team for that.)

Tactics 3 features 28 pre-painted ships and will be available for sale in both a 4-ship starter product and single-figure blind boosters.
categories: Collectible Components, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Ich spiele Einkaufen
description:
Translated from the German introduction:

"Dear parents, Ich spiele Einkaufen shall support children playfully to develop a better understanding of the numbers and quantities from 1-5. The vocabulary can be expanded as well. For this discuss all items on the shopping lists and the names of the shops repeatedly. Since there are regional differences in naming the goods and shops just use the one most appropriate to you."


Ich spiele Einkaufen is a children's game which shall help to develop competence in the number range 1-5. Each player is given a list with 5 different items on it in 5 different amounts (1-5) which need to be gathered from 5 different shops.

The game map shows the different shops (3 times each) as well as a supermarket where you can get every good and 3 spots without any action. A 6 sided die numbered from 1-4 (1&2 are doubled) is rolled and the number is advanced on the shops track around the board.

If the player ends on a shop where he needs some good from he can claim it by naming the good and the amount of it (e.g. "I take 5 sausages from the butchery"). The player then picks the needed item token from the map and places it on his/her shopping list. The first player to collect all 5 items from the shopping list wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Community
description:
Community is a fairly simple cooperative tile-laying game where players try to connect a Home tile to all of the important "community" Location tiles (hospital, school, park, recycling center, and so on) using road tiles of varying connections. The intent is to get players (especially children) to contemplate what makes a community, as well as teach strategy and cooperation. The tiles are hexagonal.

Players first populate the board with the Home tile, then an assortment of Location tiles scattered about. Then each player receives a "hand" of three tiles, which are placed face up in front of them. This hand is replenished after each play.

Starting from Home, players on their turns place tiles that join road hex-sides, attempting to build a pattern of roadways that reaches from Home to all of the locations.

name: Warage Enascentia
description:
This game takes place in the universe of Enascentia, a famous Italian setting of the Savage Worlds rpg. The mechanics come from Warage, the card game. The result of this crossover is Warage Enascentia, a great way to expand your collection of Warage cards - thanks to the introduction of new mechanics - and expand your knowledge of the Enascentia setting.

The box comes with 4 complete decks, including 8 new Heroes (2 for each deck)- for a total of 220 cards - and 20 Season cards.

Warage Enascentia is brought to you by the collaboration of District Games and GG studio.

How it works
In Warage Enascentia you are a hero which has particular buffs and abilities. There are eight Heroes, divided in four Tribes: Gromsh, Janah, Kronoss and Senduar.

In Warage Enascentia, as in Warage, your Hero will have to fight against the other(s). You can equip your Hero with weapons, armours, spells, mounts etc, in order to power him up and defeat the opponent(s).
Each one of the four decks inside the box are ready to play. In each deck - made of 48 cards + 2 Hero cards - you will find already the equipments of your hero, his spells etc. You just have to place it on the table and start playing.

To win the game, you have to:

be the last Hero in game (with more than 0 Live Points;
reach endless LP, or;
use an alternative strategy - which is usually the ability of your hero (eg. "Headshot").
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Catapult Pizza
description:
Information from the back of the box:

Use your ninja skills to knock down villains (Shredder, Kraang Droid, and Foot Clan Soldier) by hitting them with pizzas launched from your pizza catapult! With four catapults launching pizzas at the sae time, it's pies to the sky, dude.

name: The Voting Game: Fill In The Blank Expansion
description:
Get creative with this expansion pack. Make each question your own by filling in the blank. What will you think of when it’s your turn?

Questions are always fresh when it’s up to you to complete the sentence. Use words and names that apply to the people you’re playing with to take it to the next level.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Templarmech Inquisition
description:
Templarmech Inquisition takes place in a future where Templarmechs, Cybersamurai, TechnoVikings, and Gamma/Meta/Star Romans go to war.

The game is played with units (cards) arranged in ranks. Player can command units to mobilize (move) or activate to perform various actions. Players decide on their commands in secret and preform them simultaneously. Players can use honor to bring more units into play.

name: Shittaka Eiga Kenkyuka
description:
User summary:
・知ったか映画研究家 (Shittaka Eiga Kenkyuka) is a game in Japanese from the game designer Subuta. In English, the game would be called "Know-It-All Movie Critics". The game is produced on A4 sheets which the player cuts up into cards accordingly.

By an unexpected turn of events, you're attending a movie forum to discuss movies you've never heard of. You need to comment on the movies as if you know them thoroughly.

Combine two title cards to form an imaginary movie title. Once the movie title is determined, take turns to discuss the movie. You may say whatever comes to your mind about the movie. Other players may also talk to back up your speech. Note that other players must agree with whatever you say about the movie. As the turn player, make a speech for about 30 seconds and then address the next player.

When all the players have made their speech, they shall concurrently appoint a player whose speech has impressed them the most. The player who is selected by the highest number of players shall win the title as the best know-it-all movie critic!

Its 2nd Edition, which will be released at Game Market Tokyo 2015 Autumn, will
be available in Japanese and English.

Publisher's summary:
ひょんな事からあなた達は映画の評論会に出席することになってしまいました。
けれどもその評論会の映画は聞いたこと無いタイトルばかり。あなたは知ったかぶって発言しないといけません。
タイトルカードを2枚組み合わせて架空の映画タイトルを作ります。
映画タイトルが決まったら、その映画を順番に評論します。自分の思いつくままに好きな内容を発言出来ます。他の人もフォローしたり頷いたり出来ます。
ただし、発言内容はどんなにメチャクチャでも全て肯定しなければなりません。
持ち時間は1人30秒ほどです。
全員分評論を終えたら、最も心を動かす発言をした人を一斉に選びます。
一番選ばれた人が最も優れた知ったか映画研究家です！
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Jenga Gold
description:
A new spin on the classic Jenga game:

Stack it, Crash it, Grab it! 54 golden Jenga blocks, but in this game if your block has a star, it's "real" gold, keep it. If there's no star... it's "fool's" gold so place it on top.

When the tower crashes down everyone scrambles to find the "real" gold. Collect the greatest Jenga fortune to win!

Pull out a block, without crashing the stack, collect the blocks with a star, to win at this version of Jenga!

name: Ninja All-Stars: Arashikage
description:
Arashikage is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars. Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

The silent and masked Arashikage has walked Kagejima for seven years on a quest for vengeance. Ever since he witnessed one of his peers apparently murder his Tora master, he has longed to hunt down the killer. For the right price, Arashikage will use his mastery of Fire and Water to help your team in the Moonlight Tournament, but only so long as he feels it brings him closer to his goal of revenge.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Fire and Water Wielding, Revenge-Seeking Ronin
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Sports, Video Game Theme
publishers: Heidelberger Spieleverlag, Ninja Division, Soda Pop Miniatures, Ulisses Spiele

name: Ninja All-Stars: Ondori Clan Kaiken
description:
Ondori Clan Kaiken is a mercenary ronin for Ninja All-Stars.Ronin bring potent new abilities to a player’s team that are entirely unique to them. As mercenaries, ronin may be used by any player, on any team. This makes ronin invaluable assets for every team, regardless of clan, since they may be used to supplement a team’s weaknesses in battle or further augment their strengths.

Hidden in the forests and groves of northern Kagejima, the Ondori clan are mysterious and almost legend to most of the island. They only occasionally trade with, or even contact, their nearest neighbors. Those who do interact with them describe the Ondori as proud, fiery, and surprisingly well-informed. In the last century, more and more of these enigmatic shinobi have appeared and bargained their services to other clans for the Moonlight Tournament. With flashing claws and a sharp beak, they challenge all who stand in their way with their unique fighting style that baffles opponents and allies alike.

Highlights:

Introduces Unique Abilities
Fully Assembled Model
Fierce, Feathered Avian
Mercenary Ronin
categories: Adventure, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Miniatures, Sports, Video Game Theme

name: Sheep, Sheep and Sheep
description:
"Sheep Pasture" is a big farm with several large flocks of long-haired black sheep and white sheep. Because the farmer takes care of them with love, the sheep are fat and furry. Therefore, the big wolves see such beautiful sheep as delicious food. Can you help the farmer to count the sheep and chase the big wolves away?

To set up Sheep, Sheep and Sheep, a.k.a. 幾隻羊, deal the deck of pasture cards evenly among all players. Create a space in the center of the playing area that's about two cards long by two cards wide. Flip up enough cards from players' decks that the pasture has four cards in it.

On a turn, a player points to where they want to place a pasture card, then flips over a card from their deck into this space on top of any other cards there. Whoever first calls out the correct number of visible sheep on pasture cards receives a point tile as a reward. Once all the point tiles have been handed out, the game ends and whoever has collected the most of them wins.

name: KaZock
description:
In KaZock, players try to get as many carrots as possible with dice luck and tactical flair.

Sometimes it is better to be satisfied with what you have achieved than to risk too much. The main thing is that in the end you have your nose in front and most of the carrots are collected.

On your turn, you roll three dice. Depending on the result of the dice, one or two carrots can then be taken from the supply or stolen by an opponent. Unfortunately, if you are unlucky you have to give back some of your hard-collected carrots.

In this game it is recommended to not only keep an eye on your own carrot pile, but to also watch the collections of the other players.

The game ends when the carrot supply in the middle of the table is used up and the player with the most carrots wins!

—description from the designer

name: Yubitsume
description:
Fingers off the dice!
You only keep your fingers if you move them at the right moment. If you are late or if your paws are grabbing the wrong place, you will soon nolonger be able to pickle.

Osaka‘s yakuza bosses have a problem. Their people are rotting away,
the lack of discipline is rampant. It cannot go on like this! After the latest
scandal, it is finally time to act and apply the best practices. From now
on the following applies: Yubitsume ... Every misconduct costs a finger.

Yubitsume means shortening of the fingers. Fortunately,m this game is
not like the original, in Japan. With Yubitsume, the yakuza have to snip
themselvers when they screw up. It follows a strict ritual: You cut off a
finger joint in the same presence of the lan chief. If the boss is in a nasty
mood, it can be a bit more. You repeat that until ... need we say more.

Even in the Heldbergs‘ game Yubitsume, mistakes and inaction do not go
unpunished. Whenever that happens normally with the yakuza, fingers
come off, if you still have some to remove! But rest assured, everything
runs more gently and - let‘s say more symbolically - in this game.

name: The Singaporean Dream: The New Normal
description:
The Singaporean Dream: The New Normal is the latest edition of The Singaporean Dream, an interactive card game that lets you pay, steal, and sabo your way to be the perfect Singaporean.

You play a classic Singaporean Personality (different for each player) that grants you special powers.

The game goal is to collect as many dream as you can before the dream pile runs out. You can buy the Dream Cards with Cash Cards in the bank or gain them with Action Cards.

During your turn, you draw two cards and play up to 3 actions:

play an action card from your hand;
place money in bank (cards from hand to table);
buy a dream using money in bank;
use personality special power.


Keep doing this until the dreams runs out.

name: Mixture Mischief
description:
In this cooperative game a group of young alchemists try to prepare potions before the ingredients run out. Players add ingredients - play different coloured cards into the cauldron. However, mischievous cats will cause a lot of trouble and can ruin the recipe.
The goal of the game is to prepare as many potions as possible, working together, adding ingredients, and repairing the mischief caused by the cats. The players have won if they prepare enough potions before the ingredients run out. The more they prepare, the better the final score.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: No way José!
description:
Somewhat similar to the party game No Way!, but without the bluffing element. Each card in the game has a category - such as Marvel superheroes or traditional dishes - with six items in it, some true and some false, but all sounding like they could be true. The player in turn reads out the items and the other players mark them as right/wrong on their personal sheets, the correct row is then read out, and those with the most correct answers in it get a point. After every player has had the chance to be José three times, the game is over and those with the most total points win.

This is part of Tactic's small box travel games series.

name: Nishikigoi
description:
The design of the Koi ponds may have a great effect on the Nishikigoi’s health and well-being. The Emperor has chosen you to build perfectly suitable ponds, so the carps can reach their highest potential. To do so, you must assign each Koi colony its proper place.

In each round, players have to cooperate assigning a different group of carps splitting the pond. It’s important to optimise the area to shelter the most colonies.

In turn you need to build the perfect home to the colony.

First, determine the perfect pond rolling the 3 dice. These dice show you the exact number of nishikigoi you must have inside a pond area when it’s closed.

To shape the pond, each player must play a Pond card (placed partially other cards) in turn order until a pond area is completely (the wather lilies line is closed). To do so, the card can be partially placed over other cards in play (never underneath).

When the pond is closed, if the exact number of nishikigoi of each colour matches the dice, remove 5 of the played cards and put them at the bottom of the deck. The rest are set aside to show you have built a perfect pond area.

The game ends when all cards have been played. There is no more space in the imperial pond and it’s time to evaluate how well you have done.

—description from the publisher

name: Flash Match
description: How good is your memory? Good enough to remember 20 pictures if they flash briefly on the screen? What about 34 pictures? Or 41? What if they flash at a rate of 10 per second? Could you pick them out of a crowd? And could you make your opponents think they saw pictures that never really appeared? You'll need all of these skills to play Flash Match, the VCR game that tests your ability to concentrate, remember and bluff.

name: Escape Game: Das geheimnisvolle Museum
description:
You have just arrived at a museum when suddenly the lights go on and off continuously.... and the windows open and close without you being able to hold them. You look for the exit, but realise that the museum is a veritable labyrinth of rooms and corridors: You are lost!

The game includes a set of puzzle cards, a game board and useful items to find the clues.

name: Hold Everything!
description: Reggi un Attimo! ("Hold it!" in the Pressman american version) is a party-game where players must hold common objects such as umbrellas, pens, chairs, keys or whatever it is decided in the deck of personalizable cards - the players may choose the objects they have at home in that moment. The deck supplied has some suggestions: televisions, glasses, fishbowls (!) and bottles. The board is constructed with cards as well: landing on a space may force you to hold another object or to pass or exchange one with other players. If a player drops an object, he must get two as a penalty. The player getting rid of all his objects wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Party Game
publishers: AMIGO, Pressman Toy Corp., Quality Games

name: Central Powers, Axis & Allies Variant
description:
A set of World War I variant pieces and rules from Table Tactics.

"This game adds 200 new color matched plastic pieces and directions on how to play this WWI version. When playing Central Powers you use the original Axis & Allies game board and over 200 of the original game pieces for a great new version of this classic game. Central Powers is not designed to be historically accurate. Its main purpose is entertainment. Rules for Central Powers pieces also allow you to use them in the original game. Cruisers, destroyers, artillery, machine guns, half-tracks, & the Mark II Tanks to your game plan."

Expands:

Axis & Allies
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Galileo
description: Bit by bit, players reveal sky tiles that show 1-3 stars or 1-3 planets. Players wager on which will predominate. When the 4 planets nearest to a telescope are revealed, wagers are resolved. Though the game steadily progresses, it's not completely static, as face-up tiles can be replaced with facedown tiles drawn from a bag. A light memory game with a nice tactical element.

name: Deception
description: Poker game in which players look at and claim concealed playing cards to form poker hands. After a round of betting, players reveal their hands. A memory component is introduced at this stage, as the players view more cards than necessary to form their hands. Endorsed by Jack Klugman and Tony Randall.

name: Super Rally
description: From the publisher: Super Rally is a different game where the board is a trail that changes at each game. Alternate stretches of forests, cities, fields and deserts with their specific difficulties. As it is a long race night overs and car maintnance must be considered. Everything is present in this game and in order to win, you can't forget anything.

name: Sieben
description:
Cards have a number (1-7) at the top, and a hole at the bottom. Each player starts each round with 7 cards. The starting player plays a card face up to the discard pile. In turn order, players discard a card directly on top of the discard pile, either playing hole-on-hole or hole-on-number. The sum of visible numbers must be equal to or greater than the previous sum, but no higher than 7.
- If you cannot play, take a penalty card -- turn over.
- If you discard a card and the sum is not 7, draw a card -- play passes to next clockwise player.
- If the sum is 7, set aside that discard pile and start a new one by playing another card -- your turn is over (do not draw a card).
If a new draw pile is needed, shuffle all cards already set aside.

When a player runs out of cards (plays their last card creating a sum of 7), they take 1 VP chip + 1 chip per player remaining. Play continues until only 1 player is left with cards.

With 2-4 players, the game ends after 7 rounds; with 5-7 players, play till the VP chips have all been handed out. The player with the most VP wins!

name: Evil Genius: Deathray Vile Deck
description:
45 card expansion pack for Evil Genius: Deathray.

This collection of the darkest, most inappropriate humor we could dig up from depravity is yours for the taking. Usually, the visuals for such base humor is left to your imagination, but we'be punished our artist by having him put his talents (and morals) to the test. Enjoy the darker side of life, but don't expect any cookies.

name: ¿Quién es el más burro?
description: Board game with questions and answers in which you have to guess a character or a place offering clues. The first to reach the final square wins. The board further has a series of boxes that hamper progress in balancing the culture of the players.

name: Munchkin Panic: Instant Gratification Promo
description:
Promo for Munchkin Panic given out at Origins 2015.

Instant Gratification

Description: Once per game, play Instant Gratification to immediately add earned Treasure to your hand.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Ernst von Mansfeld
description:
We write the year 1623 and there is war in the German lands. Even from distance, you can hear the steady beating of the drums. The recruiters with their sounding coins come to town and try to recruit new soldiers for the mercenary armies, which are being excavated everywhere. You hope the recruiters will be successful because they work on your behalf.

Ernst von Mansfeld is a tactical dice game for 2 to 4 players and is divided into the 2 consecutive phases recruiting and conquering.
In the recruitment, the players try to win as many and powerful soldiers as possible for their mercenary army. This requires tactics and clever consideration of the risk, as the player who dares to reach the required dice value with fewer dice than his competitors may try his luck first.
In the second phase, the players have to compete with their deployed armies against each other to conquer different valuable provinces. The smart use of your own troops as well as the correct anticipation of the tactics of the opponents are necessary to secure the provinces and to enter history as the most successful mercenary general.

name: Party & Co: Pick One
description:
Challenge your friends with Party & Co Pick One, the most daring party!

In this new version of the game you put your friends to the test and you get to know them from a whole other side! Use your senses or test that of your fellow players.

Do you recognize your friends by their smell? And who can not tickle? With the various assignments and game accessories you will be thoroughly tested!
—description from the publisher (translated)

Daag jouw vrienden uit met Party & Co Pick One, het meest gewaagde feest!

In deze nieuwe uitvoering van het spel stel je jouw vrienden op de proef en leer je ze van een hele andere kant kennen! Gebruik jouw zintuigen of test die van je medespelers.

Herken jij jouw vrienden aan hun geur? En wie kan er niet tegen kietelen? Met de verschillende opdrachten en spelaccessoires worden jullie flink getest!

—description from the publisher (Dutch)

name: A Charlie Brown Christmas: Christmas Journey
description:
You have been chosen by Charlie Brown to help discover the true meaning of Christmas. The celebrations can't start until Charlie Brown and the gang return with the greatest Christmas tree in all the land. Gather your friends as you all journey through an icy winter wonderland. Remember, it's not what's under the Christmas tree that matters, it's who's around it. Who will be the first to help Charlie Brown?

Enjoy this entertaining Peanuts game brimming with Charlie, Snoopy, Linus, Sally, and all the gang as they make their way along this winter journey. Now, you can celebrate the Christmas spirit any day of the year.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ick: The Game
description:
Welcome to the world of Ick! where you're only as good as you are gross. In this fast-paced game, players collect a colorful assortment of monster cards and place their monster's favorite gross stuff (from toxic slime to gooey eyeballs and severed limbs) into a monster's dream house—a mildew-infested shack. King Stink cards can steal a player's loot of monsters and gross stuff, allowing for plenty of quick, silly play. When the cards run out, tally up the points—whoever collects the most gross stuff wins!

~from publisher's website

In Ick: The Game, players get a hand full of cards, set down a house card (if they have one) put crap in it (adding as many objects as they can), and cap it off with the monster that belongs with the last object placed.

For example, player A has six cards on his turn--A house, a band-aid, fish bones, rotten veggies, maggots, and the monster known as Slimon. He lays down the house card, followed by all of the item cards he has except the maggots. He can either end his turn or place the maggot card and the Slimon monster card to prevent other players from claiming that stack with their monster (except it's still not safe from the one monster that can take over any house). Players earn points based on the objects in the claimed house; the first player to 100 points wins the game.

name: Mehen
description:
In the 1920s, anthropologists, explorers and adventurers found a curious spiral-tracked game being played by the Baggara Arabs of the Sudan —Li'b el Merafib, “The Hyena Game”. In all essential details the "Hyena Game" seems to have been identical to the Ancient Egyptian game of Mehen (The Game of the Coiled One). The board's shape suggests it may be a distant ancestor of the Game of Goose but the mechanics are so different that this is probably a coincidence.

It was played on a spiraling track, employed stick dice (throwing sticks) of precisely the kind known from Archaic Egyptian contexts, and had two types of pieces, one representing a predatory animal. The only difference would seem to be that the ancient Egyptians allotted six counters to each player rather than only one. The Cretan Phaistos Disc may have been a Mehen board, but that remains speculation.

Mehen is the only multi-player ancient Egyptian board game known, the others (Senet, Aseb, Hounds & Jackals, etc.) being all two-player games. The main function of the serpent-shaped Egyptian god Mehen was to protect the sun-god Ra from his enemies by coiling around him. In the Old Kingdom, the race-game Mehen took the name and shape of the god: a coiled serpent with the gaming spaces on its back. As "bodyguard", Mehen symbolises the sun-god's immediate neighborhood for the deceased. The deceased walks towards Ra on the back of the serpent-god.

By the early Middle Kingdom, the ‘cuts’ used on the snake's back of the Mehen board to separate the playing spaces were thought to ‘kill’ the snake —which would have been a very threatening and evil thing. Mehen’s role was essential, for if Ra were not protected from his enemies, he might not rise in the morning, which would result in the cessation of all life. In Egyptian belief, ‘life’ applied not only to the living but also to the dead, who were believed to travel with the sun and to rise, reborn, with him at dawn. From that time forth, the game apparently ceased to be played, possibly banned and forbidden.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: (Public Domain), Ediciones SALVAT, Fratelli Fabbri Editori  (Fabbri Editore), Geoludie, HistoryGames.it, L. P. Septímio, NewVenture Games, Origem, Pandora Games

name: SoloQuest
description:
SoloQuest is a solitaire card game.

In this game you are a powerful mage fighting with his spells the creatures that lives on the astral planes of the four Aristotelian elements: Fire, Water, Air and Earth.
You can build the game modifying a standard poker card deck or printing and cutting the cards you will find in the files at the end of this paragraph.
All cards have the symbols of standard cards, so you can use them to play normal poker, ramino or bridge.

As in all solitaires, winning the game is not easy. Please don't be discouraged if in your first game you lose. With training you can acquire enough skill to win one game every eight played.
Have fun!
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Memory, Print & Play

name: Coco Razzi
description:
From the publisher's website:

Zoom through the jungle at breakneck speed!

Excitement in the jungle. It’s market day and the jungle inhabitants want to sell their fruit. A large troop of monkeys helps them to carry the heavy baskets to market. But watch out - thieves have their eye on all the goodies. The other jungle inhabitants want to steal your fruit. Along with Pongo, the little monkey, they take the nicest fruit out of your baskets! Pongo is lurking somewhere along the long trek through the jungle and suddenly jumps out of the trees – in one fell swoop, your fruit is all gone. And what about you? If you get a chance, you can also try, with Pongo’s help, to steal fruit out of another basket. That’s the way of the jungle. Just take care that you don’t take a coconut by mistake. No-one likes them and you’ll have to keep them. The winner is the person who has brought the most fruit to market. So off you go!
contents

1 gameboard (11 ½ x 11 ½ in./29 x 29 cm), 12 baskets, 1 magnetised monkey, palm tree structures, 32 fruit chips, 2 palm tree tops, 3 market places, 2 coloured dice, 25 action cards, instructions

name: Ding Dong Forest
description:
A set of five games played with musical instruments. In "Deep in the Ding Dong Forest," players compete to turn over matching tiles and be the first to place three different baby animals in their mouse homes.

Publisher's description:

Play along with the My Very First Games: Ding Dong Forest from HABA! Every animal of the Ding Dong Forest knows how to play an instrument. Only little mouse Mia cannot decide which instrument she wants to play. So one by one, she visits her friends and tries their instruments. In five very different games, children become acquainted with simple rhythms and different sounds while, at the same time, their musicality, creativity, and imagination is enhanced! A musical game collection for children ages 2 and up!

name: Myth: Gotta Get Those Ducats Promo
description:
