description:
Pora Liczyć ("Let's Count") is a quick game about counting. Easy ruleset and the possibility to alter the rules to fit the younger audience make for a fun way to learn simple maths.

What is it all about?
Put 9 or 16 cards on the table in a square (3x3 or 4x4). Put the rest in a stack. Take the topmost card of the stack and turn it to the other side. The biggest object on the card (for example a carrot)is the one players will be looking for on the other cards in a square. The player who first finds the correct number of carrots earns a point. Whoever collects a certain number of points - wins.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Pora liczyć to dynamiczna gra oparta na szybkim liczeniu lub szacowaniu. Proste zasady połączone z możliwością dostosowania rozgrywki dla młodszych graczy, to recepta na szybką i niezobowiązującą zabawę z matematyką.

Pora liczyć wszystkie jabłka na stole!

na czym to polega?
Rozłóż na stole od 9 do 16 kart i ułóż je w kwadracie. Resztę kart ułóż w stosie obok.
Wyciągnij pierwszą kartę ze stosu i odwróć ją. Największy przedstawiony na nich obiekt (np. marchewka) trzeba teraz odnaleźć pośród wszystkich kart ułożonych w kwadracie.
Czym prędzej wskaż liczbę obiektów (np. marchewek) na kartach. Jeśli trafiłeś - zdobywasz punkt! Zdobądź ich określoną liczbę a wygrasz grę!

—description from the publisher

name: Rhombo Continuo
description:
Similar to Continuo, but uses tiles shaped in the form of a rhombus (diamond shaped pieces).

Each tile is made of 16 smaller "rhombos" colored in a pattern. Each turn you draw a tile and place it anywhere adjacent to a layout of tiles trying to extend chains of the same color crossing more than 1 tile.

The rhomboid pieces create more interesting (and higher scoring) patterns than in regular Continuo.
publishers: David Westnedge, U.S. Games Systems, Inc.

name: STYX 666
description:
Phlegyas has asked you to become the Master of Styx, but to do so you must fight your opponent on the banks of the river to Hell: The STYX.

For that use Wrathful's help to conquer this famous STYX.

6 factions, 6 forces and 6 Faculties all different that you will need to control during an infernal duel..."

Become the Master of STYX by controlling all the “wrathful” living there (or the majority of survivors).

To do so, on your turn, you can :

Either draw a visible « Wrathful » card and you play a « Wrathful » card from your hand by following the rules of installation.
Or, if you have less than 4 cards in your hand, choose to draw a face-down "Wrathful" card and your turn is over.


Once a player controls the five « Wrathful » of the STYX (When all cards are directed to him), he gains automatically and becomes the Grand Master of the STYX !
As soon as there is no more deck face up, we can not play anymore, the game ends, and, the player with the most STYX cards directed towards him, become Master of STYX.
The other player just passed on the other side of the river, synonymous of Hell ...

name: Jooky Jooky
description:
Specially designed for families with children ages 6 and up, Jooky Jooky is a game about an intrusive insect that players will delight in chasing through 4 different challenges: labyrinth, search & find, majority and alive.

Each player, armed with a swatter, must take a good look at the challenge card in play and be the first to correctly complete the challenge, either by swatting Jooky with their swatter or by swatting the card. The fastest player wins the card. The first player to collect 10 Cards win the game.

This game, which relies on speed, dexterity and observation skills, can easily be adapted to the age and abilities of its players.

Although Jooky Jooky may seem a bit childish at first glance, don’t be fooled, as both children and adults will have a great time! The whole family will enjoy playing this simple yet lively game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game
publishers: Broadway Toys LTD, Greater Than Games, LLC, HeidelBÄR Games, Magellan, Pendragon Game Studio, Synapses Games

name: What Do You Meme?: Stoner Expansion Pack
description:
Perfect images and captions that embody the "Stoner" culture.

Includes 65 Cards (50 Caption cards & 15 Photo cards) to be added to core game.

Add the cards to their respective decks and play as normal.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Summ herum
description:
Frederic is a really pesky frog! What he likes most is to tease the little bees, as they fly across his pond. With his magnetic sticky tongue, he catches the busy nectar gathering animals. Which smart bee, with some luck and tactical thinking, will sneak past the frog?

Ages 4 and up

name: Rainbow Timber
description:
"The colorful family game of rolling, sliding and stacking...."

Players roll a large color-dot die, and then must try to remove a corresponding colored block from the tower and place it on top of the tower. The last player to make a successful play before the tower falls wins the game.

This game is similar to some Jenga versions that have colored planks, but has more colors.

Similar to Tumblin Dice Timberrr but this game has more planks (54 vs 48), it has more colors (6 vs 5), and there are some differences in the rules, perhaps the main one being that there is no option to "Pass" on the die, so that players are on the hot seat every turn and don't get any turns during which they are not at risk.
publishers: Cayro, The Games, HABA, T.C. Timber/Habermaass Corp, Vini-Spil

name: LSD: Linearity, Simplicity, Duality
description:
Warning: This game is only for 2 players or 4 players, not for 2-4 players as described in the summary. You cannot play a 3 player game.

(From publisher's website:) Don't be fooled by the size (10×3.8×3.8 cm), LSD is a complete abstract tile placing game for 2 or 4 players, with no luck involved!

With just an open hand of 20 tiles, try to be the first to get a row of your tiles on the table. Blocking paths, capturing tiles, and reducing the opponents ability to play new tiles are all ways to gain the advantage. Play with 4 players to experience the weirdest 'team play' ever!

Although it is easy to learn, the complexity of this game will definitely surprise you!

name: Dungeon Monsters
description:
In the Dungeon Monsters card game, we are brave heroes walking around a dungeon full of cretaures, like Djinns, Trolls, Manticores, Rats and others. The goal is eliminate all your cards. The first one will be "The Legendary Hero", and the latter two will be the "bananas".
The game consists in discard any number of one type of card (represented by a number). The Legendary Hero is the first to play, and the next player must put exactly the same amount of cards with a minor number, and so on, untill all players don't have or dont't want play, and pass.

From the box:
Desça no Dungeon. Mate os monstros. Arrase seus amigos!
Em Dungeon Monsters não basta matar o monstro mais poderoso. Você deve matar todos eles, e antes dos seus oponentes! Quem conseguir se livrar antes de todas as suas cartas de criatura vence o jogo e conquista o título de “Herói Lendário”, ficando com toda a glória, riqueza e status - além do sagrado direito de espoliar, tripudiar e desdenhar os aventureiros menos afortunados...

name: Ramen Chef
description:
Ramen — for some, it is a brutally delicious noodle soup originally from Japan. For its makers, ramen is the center of an intensely brutal fight in a mega-market. In the metropolis of Tokyo, cooks compete fiercely for the best ingredients so they can satisfy their customers' needs and desires.

In Ramen Chef, you are at the forefront of this battle. Play as one of up to four chefs who run their soup business with sophistication and brains in order to become Tokyo's greatest ramen chef. Your greatest weapon? Your smart head!

Ramen Chef features a literal flip of a classic memory game. You are trying to match ingredients from a 3x3 grid, and collect ingredients that match a secret objective. However, all of the ingredient tiles are double-sided, meaning you need to remember both sides of the tiles in front of you. On your turn, you must verbally state the ingredient you see BEFORE you flip, then flip the tile to reveal the opposite side. If after the second flip, your two tiles (on their opposite sides) now match, you are able to collect one of those tiles for your restaurant and work towards fulfilling your secret objective tile. The player with the most tiles — both ingredients and completed objective tiles— wins.

But be careful! If the opposites sides of your target tiles do not match, you collect nothing, and may leave a combination of tiles that your opponent can now use instead. Surprisingly tactical and shockingly difficult for only nine tiles, Ramen Chef is sure to leave you questioning your memory abilities and hungry for ramen!

—description from the publisher

name: 3 Men on a Horse
description:
Milton Bradley game #4367. Each player begins on START with their horse and 3 men in front of them. Object is to race around the track and cross the FINISH with 3 men on your horse or if you cross the FINISH without the 3 men you sprint around the track at twice the normal speed to try and complete the second lap before any other person completes their first lap with 3 men on their horse.

Based on the 1936 Warner Bros. comedy movie of the same name.

name: Press Your Luck Board Game
description:
Now you can play PRESS YOUR LUCK, the classic TV show, at home with your friends and family. Unfold the scoreboard, write your names, ask each other questions from the cards plus download the free Press Your Luck Appcessory to play the Electronic Big Board! But look out for those nasty Whammies. And speaking of Whammies, this edition includes a fantastic, collectable Plush Whammy!

The game lasts 3 rounds (2 for short game, 4 for long game). Each round consists of the host reading four question cards to the players. You will collect three spins if you answer the question correctly and are the first to lay down the answer card. If you lay down the correct answer card and are not first, you still get one spin. Zero spins for the wrong answer. After the question round, you get to play the Big Board and spend your spins. At any time, you can pass your spins to the next player and make them press their luck!

The winner is whoever survives the Whammys and makes the most money.

name: Dump
description: This is a prototype design about territorial competition between dogs in a neighborhood. Each player is a dog that tries to have the most prestigious and extensive territory by going around pooping and peeing on streets, lawns, and yards to mark their area. The center of neighborhood is occupied by the park, the jewel in the eyes of all dogs to claim as their own. To achieve top dog status players will come across trash cans (for resupply) and fire hydrants that help in scoring more points.

name: Quartier Latin
description:
from web page:

You are the owner of a fancy bistro in the fashionable Quartier Latin in Paris, the most important investments are made: you have bought tables, chairs and tableware and have engaged fairly qualified personnel. Shortly before the opening of your pub the disaster happens. The competitors send hooligans to your premises that are about to destroy your work. You are determined to fight. Let 's hope that you have better cards than your opponents!

Two teams of two or three players compete with the aim to open as many pubs as they can. But they not only try to set up their own enterprise but also to cancel the efforts of the other team by any means. For this purpose the teams can hire hooligans and bombers to threat the opponents. They can also cause other inconveniences like influenza for the personnel of the other team, pipe bursts or denial of credit. The other team can defend themselves with their own hooligans, managers or the two doormen Gaston and Gustave. Both, developing / opening of pubs and getting rid of the competitors, gain points. You have, for example, destroyed the other teams disco. Not only do the others not score points with their disco if you call a disco your own, their customers come to your premises (where else could they dance?) and you collect MONEY (points)!! But even if you only have a simple beer garden, the bomb attack was useful for your business because the disco-dancers will visit the other pubs of the quarter if they don 't find their favorite disco, and yours is one of them.

By the end of the game the most successful gastronome is obviously the one with the most points.

name: Field of Fire
description: A home made miniatures game designed by Eric Alleman. The game features a German attempt to hold on to a Soviet town using rules modified from a World War II Squad Leader type miniatures game.

name: LifeLinks
description: LifeLinks is an easy-to-learn card game that teaches kids 8 and up about the way plants and animals depend on each other to survive. Players must build webs of cards that fit together while fending off both human and natural threats to their expanding ecosystems. Different versions of the game allow for team play and co-operative play, where players must work together to succeed.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Negotiation, Puzzle
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Trading

name: Clean Sweep
description: The gameboard has spaces for the numbers one through nine, and a circle in the center for the pot. Each turn, players roll two dice and claim any numbers that add up to the number rolled. Players score all chips on the spaces, but lose it all on a bust. The center pot is won on a Clean Sweep, when all nine numbers are claimed.

name: Verflixt und Zugesperrt
description: The players open heavy safe doors. They can do so only with matching keys. Valuable gems that everyone wants to win hide in the safe. However, there are also locks that one can use in order to deny access to certain gems. Whoever gets the most high-quality gems is the winner.

name: The Guru's Famous Baseball Game
description: The perfect baseball game that you'll call your favorite. Easy to play and free to try. Accurate baseball simulation game, using the player's real stats, realistic pitcher/batter interaction. More strategy options than with other games. Unique player salary on each card lets you know what the player was really worth. Ideal for drafting teams using salary caps. Clutch and Choke ratings for performance in pressure situations. Use players from different eras at the same time.

name: GRYB Game System
description:
GRYB Game System (for Green, Red, Yellow, and Blue) is imprinted on a bandana. The unique game-board is based on a four-level-deep four-branch tree structure. Instructions give parameters which players use to design their own strategy games. Three games are also given to start beginners playing.

The games published with GRYB Game System 2.0 is for 2 players. Ages range from a clever 8 up.

Players use coins as tokens, and a die is given to introduce chance into the game. The game comes with a fabric bag to store it in.

A GRYB game can be as easy or difficult a game as the player cares to create.

To find out more about GRYB go to http://www.gryb.com, or http://www.jdbgames.com. Rules are available to read online, as well as download.

Game rules published with GRYB Game System 2.0:

EZ GRYB (aka Quick & Easy GRYB) uses the tetrahedral GRYB die and allows captures.
'Drangles uses a similar scoring system, double the moves per turn, and is pure strategy.
Sumo GRYB works the same way, but uses multi-level GRYBs, which are GRYBs that span four branches, and are significantly harder to watch for and block.


Other games for GRYB Game System:

25 Men's GRYB
Smack Down
Combat
Dan's 'Drangles
Generator (uses Icehouse Pieces)
Interrupt
PyraGRYB (uses Icehouse Pieces)

name: Hopfen & Malz
description: This db spiele game can be translated to "Hops and Malt" in English. The goal of the game is to brew the best beer using ingredients associated with the German purity law: Malt, hops, and water. There is a card deck associated with each of these 3 ingredients: a malt deck, a hops deck and a water deck. Players have a limited amount of money to purchase ingredients for their beer. Ingredients in each deck are valued from 1 (worst ingredients) to 6 (best ingredients). The decks are shuffled separately and the 3 decks are placed face down in the table. The top card of each deck is turned over. In turn, each player may buy any of the 3 ingredients with their money. This continues until all the ingredients are gone or the players run out of money. Now, players sell their beer at market. To make beer, you must have 1 hop card + 1 malt card + 1 water card. The value of the beer is the sum of the value of the cards. Contracts valued between 10 and 100 are turned over 1 at a time. Players use once around bidding with their beer to buy the best contracts. The total value of the contracts purchased determines the winning player.

name: Energy Quest
description:
In Energy Quest, each player is the president of an energy corporation, developing energy sources so as to sell the output. Two basic types of property are on the board: raw materials (coal, oil, etc.) and power sites, where energy can be produced (electric stations and the like). World Oil Price will rise steadily if unpredictably as the game progresses, making some propositions profitable in the later stages.

There are two sets of currency: dollars and kilowatt-hours (kWh). You buy energy from a player when you land on his developed power site, but the real victory condition is accumulating kWh "receipts" whenever you land on your won power sites or pass "Take Off" (e.g. "Go"). Money and property are not counted at the end, so you must gauge carefully how much money to invest in kWh receipts as the game goes on.

name: Mbogo
description:
Mbogo is a card game for 2-6 players originally published in the late 1970's by The House of Ideas. The copy on the box reads as follows:

Mbogo -- the African Cape Buffalo. The most feared animal in the jungle. He is the fiercest if wounded or bothered. He charges with his head up until the last second and seldom misses his victim. He charges not from fear but from cold, calculated revenge. Watch for the Mbogo card in this fast moving game. Mbogo the terrible.
Components
Deck of 61 cards including

7 Antelope
7 Elephant
7 Gorilla
7 Lion
7 Rhinoceros
7 Wart Hog
11 Cage
7 Hunter
1 Mbogo

name: 1-2-3 Go!
description:
A child's first game. fun with numbers.

A children's game for two players for teaching numbers up to 6.

On their turn the child throws the 1-2-3 dice, and matches it with the appropriate cylinder, then places it on the pins on their track. When the track is finished, the player wins.

There is also an advanced version with a normal 6-sided dice, and the child has to combine cylinder shapes to cover the appropriate number of pins. There is a special plastic board to enable them to do this.

name: Airplay
description:
Music Board Game.
Players form a band. Play local gigs to earn money, make a demo tape, get a recording contact, make a single, album and video on the first circuit.
Players then move to the second circuit and go on a world tour. On the world tour, players will climb the top 20 charts. First player to the top of the "charts" WINS.

name: Rythmo
description: 2-player abstract based on a medieval game called Rithmomachy. A long checkerboard has opposing pieces moving forward and attacking according to the shape and number on the pieces. The pieces are circles, triangles and squares and the numbers run from 2 to 90. Using different rules of position and math, captured pieces are removed.
publishers: Orca Games Ltd, Quantum Games Ltd (I)

name: Spritfresser
description:
The game comes in a tube with a rolled up board that lays flat when laid out. The board depicts a motor racing circuit which varies in width from 2 squares to 4. The winner is the first past the post and the rules recommend a minimum of 3 laps. The track and other charts are printed on something akin to vinyl.

Drivers choose a speed from 1 - 12 squares with the cost of the moves measured in fuel use. The larger the change in gears (up or down), the more fuel is used. Corners have an ideal speed, and exceeding that can cause tire wear, speed loss, and movement to the outside of the curve. Engine wear at high speeds can also take place.

name: The Card Game for Lovers
description:
The Card Game for Lovers is a pleasurable "experience" of giving and receiving in which you both win.

There are 54 cards with instructions. First, one partner draws a card and acts out the given description. On each card there is a time mentioned how long you act out the given description. Then the other player takes a turn.
Both players win as you discover more about yourself, your lover and the intimate relationship you share.

name: Princess of Power Game
description: Players take on the roles of She-Ra's friends and try to free her from the dungeon in the center of the board. To do so they must find her Power Sword and the correct combination of keys that will unlock the dungeon door.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Herself the Elf: Elf-Fun Game
description: A beautiful 3D game board is the highlight of this childrens' game. Players control "Herself the Elf" as she searches for her magic wand, chases the gray cloud away, and finds her special flower...all while avoiding the evil Thorn and his daughter Creeping Ivy.
categories: Children's Game, Deduction, Exploration, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Wheeler Dealer
description: Wheeler Dealer is a game of two parts. In part one players travel the world while buying, selling, bargaining and trading world products. In part two the products are sold back to the bank or auctioned to the highest bidder
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Uncle Rez's Pets
description:
Several different games with one deck of cards. Different Pets, different colors, different sizes and whether they have spots or not distinguish the cards from one another.

Games range from 1 player solitaire games to several player trick taking games.
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Memory, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Line Drawing, Memory, Open Drafting, Trick-taking

name: Bowling Bunnies
description: From the box: "A classic game for the whole family. Features 1 soft king pin and 5 soft bunny pins, with ribbons, bells, and wooden bases; plus 2 soft, safe 'cabbage' bowling balls. Bowling Bunnies was inspired by turn-of-the-century [late 1800s/early 1900s] parlor games. During this period, long before the advent of television or radio, families would gather together to play game sin the parlor, now known as the family or living room. Or on a bright sunny day, the family would play together on the lawn! Originally called Skittles, there were many different styles of bowling games using different kinds of animals and people as pins. Our classic game brings charming bunnies to life. Children and adults will delight in seeing these bunnies fall and tumble about, inspiring the imagination of all involved. We hope that your children will enjoy the simple pleasure of setting up the little bunny pins and trying to bowl them over with the soft green cabbage balls. Bowling Bunnies are fun for the child in all of us. Begin a new tradition in your home; start a family game time today!"

name: Contiquences
description: Contiquences is the new board game that combines trivia with world power. In your quest to control the world you must show that you have the knowledge to do so. Move around the world take control of an area, but be careful your opponents may take control away from you. Can you handle the Contiquences

name: Global Summit: The Peace Game
description:
Cooperative card game in which the players represent nations at an international summit pledging economic, political, and social resources to ward off threats to world peace. There are 66 Resource cards of the three varieties in various denominations, 24 Domestic Event cards, and 18 Chaos cards. A game turn consists of drawing Domestic Event cards (which cause Resources to be drawn, discarded, or redistributed), turning over a Chaos card (which threatens the peace and requires an amount of a certain type of Resource to avert), and either passing the Chaos card to the next round or collectively playing Resource cards that total the amount required by the Chaos card in order to neutralize it. If, in ten turns, ten Chaos cards can be neutralized *and* each nation has total resource points equal to or greater than it started with, the players win.

This game was the first and possibly only one produced (in a limited edition of 500) by Pittsburgh-based Borderland Games, whose name and house logo were derived from the classic fantasy novel "The House on the Borderland" by William Hope Hodgson.

name: Life is Money
description:
From the rules...

Idea of the game:
Oh, if only I were richer. Oh, if only I could find the right one for me. Oh, what destiny do the stars hold for me. Which path should I take? This one or that? Or, is an even balance the path to eternal happiness?
In Life is Money, each player has the option of playing points in different areas of life. However, as in real life, most decisions are influenced by the actions of others.

Goal of the game:
To gain as many points as possible (varies according to the number of players) in the different areas of life. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins.

Players try to earn and spend money to gain victory points in various areas of life (Work, Education, Relationships, Spiritual Well-being, Status Symbols). You need to balance your "investments" in order to maximize your score.

name: Fire on the Suns: Tactical Command (2nd Edition)
description:
Fire on the Suns: Tactical Command 2nd (TCOM2) is a tactical starship combat and war game construction kit. The product is a CD-ROM and the game can either be printed out for head-to-head play or it can be played via hot-seat/play-by-email with software such as V_MAP (Windows version included for free.)

TCOM2 has been retired. The author, Todd Zircher, is currently developing a third edition of the Tactical Command series that will focus on a harder sci-fi setting with additions to the game mechanics such as vector movement.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: An Evening of Murder: Last Kiss
description:
One in the series of "Max Haines Invites You To An Evening of Murder (tm)" party games. This particular edition is "Last Kiss." Same format as the popular "How to Host a Murder" line.

From the Box:

Welcome to an Evening of Murder. this is a "party adventure" designed to create a night of intrigue and excitement for you and your friends. Within the comfort of your living room you set the stage for solving a MURDER.

You and your guests become the suspects. Each have hidden backgrounds and secret clues. Cast your inhibitions aside, apply your imagination, and determine who the murder is, how it was done and why.

Crime scene: Go back in time... It's 1964 and the jukebox is rockin' in the corner of the Sugar Shack Cafe. Cherry Cokes... 57 Chevy's... The Twist... and MURDER as Elmdale High's head cheerleader, Sue McNaughton, (also known as 'Runaround Sue')is found dead under suspicious circumstances...

The Suspects

Johnny B.: An ambitious rock & roll singer. He had the voice of an 'angel' but was he 'a devil in disguise'?
Jennifer Hughes: Sue's best friend and rival cheerleader. She was 'true to her school' but was she to Sue?
Chad Cunningham: The handsome captain of the football team...every girl's dream...but had he 'lost that lovin' feeling'?
Leslie Martin: The beautiful homecoming queen with the temper of a spoiled princess. Why was her favorite song 'Two Faces Have I'?
Frazer Watson: The brainy misfit...has too much studying turned his mind into 'bits and pieces'?
Lauren Sinclair: A shy and unpopular wallflower. Was she 'a prisoner of love'?
Dean Hudson: The black-leathered 'leader of the pack'. Obsessed with motorcycles and blond cheerleaders...was he heading for a 'wipe-out'?
Cindy Lewis: The sexy Go Go Dancer with a tight mini-skirt and looks that could kill. Was she more than just 'the little town flirt'?
publishers: Canada Games Company Lmt., Pentalpha Game Corporation

name: I.C.B.M.
description: I.C.B.M is a quick and nasty simulation of a thermonuclear exchange between the U.S. and the U.S.S.R.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: 3-Ring Circus Card Game
description:
Simple card game for children includes 84 cards plus the instructions card.

Some editions read 1965.

name: Keep Quiet Reword
description:
The game starts by dealing out the entire deck of alphabet cards to the players, who place them face-up in front of themselves.

After seeding the tray with a 4 or 5 letter word, a free-for-all ensues, where each player may play 1 or 2 of their letters to change the current word to another valid word (LIVE to LIKE, for example). Players who cannot create new words may steal letters from in front of other players, replacing them with any of their own.

The winner is the first to get rid of all their cards.

The educational (and the "Keep Quiet") part of the game comes from the optional use of sign language alphabet symbols to replace the letter cards.

name: Push
description:
The object of the game is to Push your Prince from its home position to one of the crowned squares on the opposite side of the board (the edge rows). This is achieved with the help of your eight Escort pieces.

On your turn, you move either your Prince (1, 2 or 3 steps) or an Escort (by its exact value: 3, 4, 5 or 6). Each step is horizontal, diagonal or vertical --but the board is odd. It is 33x33 with 64 3x3 tiles "punched out", some with a connected square remaining in the middle.

Jumps aren't allowed. A Push occurs when an Escort arrives short of another piece (Princes can't Push); what happens is that the Escort's remaining steps are transferred to the pushed piece --which may be an opposing piece or your own Prince. The pushed piece's move must be in a straight line, in the direction dictated by the collision. When the straight line isn't possible, deflection occurs as indicated in the rules. Compound pushes can occur, when a pushed piece in turn collides with another.

name: 3 Up
description:
The players alternate placing their six discs onto the 3x3 playing area. The object is to form a stack of three of your own colour. During play, no stack may grow taller than three in height.

Once all placements are done, on your turn you move a piece from atop its stack to any other stack --covered pieces cannot move. You pass if all your pieces are covered.

When two players play, each uses two colors. (There is no three-player game)

name: Murder à la carte: What the Butler Saw
description:
This is a later episode from the Murder a la Carte line by bePuzzled, and those later titles were probably published in England. At this point, it appears that bePuzzled was no longer the title holder to this large line of murder mystery party games.

Like most in the a la Carte line, this game is written for 6 players with two additional characters available who are not real suspects and whose testimony really has no impact on the game play. Comes with menu planner.

From the box:

It is 1912, and a small party has gathered in London to celebrate the engagement of Bunny Mandelson and Agatha Eton-Hogg. But then the body of Mellors, the butler, is discovered, with a revolver in his hand, a bullet in his head and suicide note that says: 'I have seen too much, and can take no more.'

What did the butler see? Did he really kill himself? Or did one of your guests murder him?
Those present at the dinner-party are:

Bunny Mandelson, a gentleman of very little brain.
Agatha Eton-Hogg, his fiancee, and inquisitive and intelligent young woman.
Sir Douglas Eton-Hogg, Agatha's uncle and a highly respected Member of Parliament.
Oscar Hemmingway III, an American big-game hunter and ivory merchant.
Sister Morticia Lewinskaya, a Russian-born nun now resident in Chicago.
Mary Lippe-Anstoldt, one of the leading stars of the Edwardian Music Hall and a friend of Agatha.
Herr Schnapps, a successful German industrialist and business-partner of Sir Douglas.
Georgette Michel, a young Frenchwoman who is only just recovering from her ordeal of going downon the Titanic.
publishers: Lombard Marketing, Paul Lamond Games Ltd, Prism Leisure Corporation PLC

name: Fighting Ships
description: One of the Helen of Toy games that had lots of low quality miniatures and were advertised in comic books in the 60s and 70s. The game is a Stratego variant with more open information.

name: Rummy 21
description:
The object of the game is to lay down sets by combining cards and tiles. First player or team to reach 1000 points wins.

Contents:

54 playing cards
60 plastic tiles
Mouse pad style board to organize play
Score pad
Rules

name: Chubby Cheeks
description:
Hamsterbacke is a children's game for 2-4 players, Ages 4 and up

The underground burrows of the little hamsters are empty once again. So the little night critters set out around the circular board to collect plenty of precious provisions--carrots, nuts, and (most valuable of all) bags of grain.

The game ends when the first hamster collects 3 grain bags, and when the provisions are counted up the hamster (player) with the most points wins.

Contents:

4 wooden hamsters
12 wooden nuts
12 wooden carrots
12 little grain bags (apparently with real seed in them!)
1 dice
1 game board.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Coach's Game
description:
Football simulation touted as NFL strategy at its best! on the box. Simplistic game whereby each player selects a play (offense and defense) and the result is determined based on the plays picked. No randomizing or multiple outcomes, just very straightforward play.

Contents:

Game board (football field representation)
Time clock disk for tracking game clock
10-yard marker
Two offensive play books -- one run and one pass (actually fold-out cards listing a total of 48 play choices and the results of each when called against each available defense)
One defensive playbook (10 defensive plays listed on a fold-out card)
One special teams playbook/card
30 token football players (one each for the 30 NFL teams existing in 1996)
Three stands
One die
One scoreboard
One rulebook.

name: Antipalos
description: Like Hex, Twixt, Connections, and similar games, the object of Antipalos is to connect opposite sides of the board. Antipalos is played on a 16X16 grid of squares, or 17x17 points. Pieces are placed in turns diagonally across the squares, connecting vertices. It is possible (unlike Hex and Twixt) for opposing lines to cross each other, where they meet at a vertex. Players are limited in the number of pieces that may be played. When the limit is reached, players must remove pieces and reposition them.

name: Gravity Blocks
description:
The game contains four sets of five uniquely shaped blocks.

Each player or team gets a complete set of five blocks of the same color. A wooden die is rolled and the color shown goes first. Players take turns balancing their blocks on a central tower. You lose if you make it fall over. The blocks are each made of a different type of wood.

Blindfolds are provided for two player teams. One person places the block blindfolded while the other coaches.

name: Mankka
description:
A version of the African game of Kalah from Copp Clark.

The game comes with a plastic tray with 12 'pits' and 48 marbles that are used as stones.

The rules provide for three different variations of the basic Kalah game which can aid players who are not familiar with the original.

name: Goal to Go Football
description:
American Football game by Dwight McGrew.

Results of Plays are on box around the board in Monopoly style.

name: P.E.G.S. (The Parker Electronic Game System)
description:
PEGS consists of a two sided gameboard which is wired so that when a yellow peg is inserted in a hole on one side of the board and a long rubber peg is inserted into the same hole from the opposite side, a chime will sound.

The board is a 6X6 grid marked off into quadrants of 9 holes each. Rules for 15 different games are included from a Battleship variant to Tic-Tac-Toe.

Sid Sackson designed 7 of the 15 games - they are:

Battle of the Blobs
Border Patrol
Football
Rapid Transit
Soccer
Space Attack
Tank Blitz


In Games (March/April 1979) added Sid Sackson two games for P.E.G.S.: Spy Network
a Connections.

name: Grid Word
description:
Players place special letter tiles on a 6×6 grid to try to form words of four letters, crossword style. Each word will give a player a certain number of points depending on the letter combinations.

When no one can make any more plays, the game is over and the player with the most points wins.

name: Smerge
description:
Smerge is a word game that uses 127 playing cards, some having single letters on them and some having 2 or 3 letters that form common letter combinations (Example TH).

There are two rule sets that come with the deck.

There is "16 Card Memory Master" where players take turns flipping over 3 cards and try to form a word with them. If a player can't make a word the letters are flipped back over, if a player can make a word he keeps the cards that he used to form the word and new cards are placed down to replace the cards used. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.

There is also "5 Card Call" In this game 5 cards are dealt out face up. The first player to see a word and call it out collects the cards in that word. More cards are added to bring the count back up to five and once again players get to look for a word and call it out. The player with the most cards at the end of the game wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Word Game

name: Super Ghouls N Ghosts
description: Board game based off the 3rd in the arcade series (the 2nd in the series apparently never got a boardgame). You once again play a knight trying to defeat the demon Loki. Roll the dice to move along the board, battle monsters as you proceed, and fulfill requirements to go from one section to the next.

name: Monster Maker 6: The 7 Sorcerers ('Spellnames')
description:
Monster Maker 6: SpellNames is a card game for players to stage a fight to become the ultimate wizard. This goal is achieved by gathering magical items that are most compatible with their character.

At the start, each player is given a secret Wizard card (each with its SpellName and element type) and a hand of cards. A Magic Item card is then revealed, starting off a round of fighting for it. Taking turns, the players draw a card from the common deck and play, keep or discard it. Through these cards, the players deploy heroes and monsters to fight, boost them up with equipment and spells, and kill off certain types of units. The player with the highest value from his cards wins the Magic Item. Played cards are discarded, and the next round begins by revealing another Magic Item.

The game ends when all cards in the deck have been drawn. The players reveal their wizards and tally the points for their artifacts' affinity with their wizard's element type. The player with the highest score is the winner. During the game, each player has one chance to guess another player's element type. If the guess is correct, the target cannot win the game at the end even if he or she has the most points.

name: Xanadu
description:
Based off the classic Falcom computer/videogame RPG.

Very similar in basic play to TSR's Dungeon!. You traverse the area, going into rooms to battle monsters and get treasures, including items needed to get into the final rooms in a castle to slay a particularly nasty dragon.

name: Giant
description:
The goal is to get to 10th level - you begin at 6th. Each player has one card for every level they are, and maintains that hand size throughout the round.

Each round the players are striving to collect sets of weapons, through fast paced Borderlands like trading. When a set is collected, it can be played on a section of game board that represents part of a giant. For instance, 3 of a kind can be played on the giant's lower legs, scoring that for the player to play it. Players who score a lot - or score the head, the last part of the giant that can be scored, go up a level for next hand.

There are some other cards also, a tombstone that is bad to have, monster attacks you play on other players, shields that protect you from these attacks, and loot that increases your starting hand size on the next hand.

name: The Quest for Maggie Darr
description:
A two player boardgame set in the world of comic hero Agent 13. The game was published in 13: Assassin magazine #5.

Maggie Darr and her henchmen are trying to track down and kill Agent 13. At the same time, Agent 13 wants to capture Maggie Darr because she holds the secret to his past.

One player takes the role of Agent 13, the other, Maggie Darr. Agent 13 must either capture Maggie or find six clues to his past and return to his Headquarters to win. The only way that the 'Maggie' player can win is to eliminate Agent 13. There is no time limit to the game.

name: Roll Bowl
description: Roll Bowl is an American football simulation game consisting of a board game football field, football players playing pieces, sideline marker playing pieces and 3 dice.

name: The Embattled Trek
description:
A very early game of "Star Trek Inspired" starship combat. Rules are intended for miniatures and tape measures, though conversions are included for BYOHM (bring your own hexgrid map).

—user summary

Precis Intermedia brings back this classic board/miniatures game. Originally published in 1977 by Wee Warriors, The Embattled Trek was created during an era without today's advanced software and print services, making indie publishers of the time truly special.

From out of the black void, two silent fleets deploy. They meet in battle to decide their disputed rights to a small but important section of the galaxy.

As a captain aboard one of the armed fighting ships of the Confederated Planetary Systems, you stand ready with your top scientists, engineers, and crew to meet the finest of a newly-contacted Empire. Facing an enemy with more-powerful weapons at short range, it is your task to use the best advantages of your individual ships to negate those of the Empire.

The Embattled Trek represents tactical level play of ship-to-ship combat between the forces of two space powers. Due to the novel combat system using subtractive percentages, the game cannot be counted as won until the last of the enemy ships is destroyed or disabled. And simultaneous plotted movement provides a clean-playing, fast game, where one mistake can cost you your fleet.

Two sizes of counters are provided to allow for hex-map play or use in tabletop gaming. Three-dimensional ships may also be used with these rules.

Requires a set of percentile dice and a six-sided die.

—description from the publisher of the revised 2019 edition
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Pargolf
description: Pargolf does an amazing job of simulating the actual game of golf. The game is played over a challenging 6970 yard par 72 test of skill judgement and luck. It requires all the shots you have in the bag.

name: Commander
description: Commander is the game of airplane pilots. Each player must collect a certain number of flight Km, making his own career by piloting bigger and bigger airplanes, and choosing starting and ending airports. This is easily made by rolling dices to travel around the world and rolling other dices to be able to take off and land on each airport.

name: Hook Line & Stinker
description:
From the box:
A funny magnetic fishing game for 2 to 4 players. No reading required. Ages 4 and up. Featuring Scratch and Sniff Skunk. Some assembly required.

You catch fish and you catch junk, but you'd better watch out or you'll catch the skunk! Scratch and sniff him if you dare, a terrible odor fills the air!

The first person to catch 3 fish of the same color wins.

name: Toothache
description:
This game is the logical companion to Operation. Players require steady hands and strong nerves to extract teeth without making their patient SCREAM!

Patients have different numbers of teeth to extract. Side teeth are more difficult than front teeth. A probe and mirror are the only tools to be used. One slip and the patient screams loud and long.

The teeth with their specially designed hooks are carefully nudged from behind the patients mouth. Only by using the mirror can you see what you are doing.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Electronic, Humor

name: Purse & Pockets Plus
description:
"2 points to the first team who brings me a.....gum wrapper!"

Watch the mayhem as everyone searches their pockets, purses, backpacks, and surroundings for the item needed. It's up to the leader to determine whether a similar item is close enough ("here's a wrapper from chewy candy!").

This party game is sort of like a scavenger hunt, but it all takes place in a single location rather than running all around the neighborhood bothering outsiders.

There are categories of items to please just about everyone:
Purse (mostly things found in ladies' purses, best for an all female group like at a shower)
Pockets (items typically found in anyone's pockets, good for most groups)
House & Garden (if you're brave enough to have people rummaging through things in your house)
Office (good for an office party or as an ice-breaker at a meeting)
Something that...(items that fit a description, such as "something that has a team logo", nice to mix this in with other categories)
Kids (can play with an all children group or kids can play with adults, as long as the leader is an adult)
Wild & Crazy (some items may be a bit wild for the standard group, but great for a bachelor or bachelorette party)

2 to 3 teams race to bring the required items, and everyone seems to enjoy it whether their team actually wins or not.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Party Game, Print & Play, Racing, Real-time

name: Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea Card Game
description: A crazy eights style game, with three suits from 1-13. There are no wild cards or special cards, just 39 oversized number cards. The person who goes out scores one point for each card left in the opponent's hands, and the game is played to 21.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Head to Head
description: Head to Head is a crossword game that is played simultaneously between two players. Players grab 14 random plastic letters from a bag, then race against each other to form words on the board, crossword-style, that score points. Squares on the board have varying point values. Players are timed with an egg-timer during play.
publishers: E. S. Lowe Company Inc., Milton Bradley

name: Polyglot
description:
The Game of International Languages

"...a game which will enable you, your family and friends to develop a greater intimacy with foreign languages."

name: Guerilla
description: Guerilla is based on the confrontation between Malaysia and Indonesia from 1963 to 1966. It simulates at section and platoon level typical operations of an infantry battalion in the First Division (Province) of Sarawak during the first half of the period of operations . . . Although an accurate simulation of the type of operations and tactics used, Guerilla does not claim to be a precise historical simulation of any particular period or aspect of the war . . . The Orders of Battle do not have any historical basis, but again are typical of the forces engaged on both sides. On the Security Force side . . . the composition of the game battalion is based on the Gurkha organization, slightly modified to suit the game."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Mobile Suit Z Gundam game: Take off MkII
description:
This boardgame is designed based on the famous Japanese animation - The Z Gundam series. This is the first set of the Z Gundam boardgame by Bandai. Therefore the game does not contain any Z Gundam miniature.

The game comes with 12 Gundam miniatures (3 of each of the following: Gundam MkII, Rick Dias, Hi-Zaku, GM2), a game board showing the space around the Earth and Moon, a set of event cards and counters.

Players can choose to play as either Titans or AEUG. Each player has a fleet and 3 MS robots at the beginning. The player who has finished his secret mission, or gets rid of all his enemies wins the game.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Miniatures, Space Exploration
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Simulation, Team-Based Game

name: Foreign Legion: Macta
description: Over five hundred men had died at the twin battles of Moulay Ishmael and Macta, most of them legionaires. It was a small battle by Napoleonic standards, less than eight thousand men engaged, but this was 1836, and the fate of the column received world wide attention . . . Although a complete game in itself, Macta contains optional rules which will allow the players to combine it with Moulay Ishmael."
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Tournament: Jousting
description: A tournament joust between knights on horseback equipped with lance and shield. The player with the most victory points at the end of three combats wins the joust.

name: Glyphe Caster
description:
From the Publisher...
There was once a powerful order of magi' known as the Casters. The Casters could carve mystical symbols in the air with their hands and their breath. They called these symbols glyphes. Weaving combinations of the glyphes the Casters could twist reality and call upon the power of the elements. From thin air they could conjure mighty storms, raging fires, howling winds, and terrifying creatures. Some say the Casters could even manipulate time itself, bending it to their will. In their quest for power, the order discovered a chaotic quasi-element. Calling upon this chaotic element was dangerous and many of the order met their doom trying to wield it's power.

GLYPHE CASTER

For 2 to 6 players - Ages 10 and up Each set includes 8 glyphe dice (enough for two players) and instructions.

A note from Paul - for $5 how can you go wrong?

name: Trivia
description:
Trivia is a game that is not so much about knowing answers to trivia questions but more about having a good vocabulary. It is almost identical to the game "Facts in Five", released a few years prior.

With the game set up, 5 cards are drawn, each with a unique list of categories. Categories from each are selected for this round. Letter tiles are drawn at random and both the categories and letters are noted on the player's pad. Players then have two minutes to try and create a word commencing with each of the letters, in each of the categories (25 words in total). At the end of the two minutes, a point is given for each word. Following, a new round begins.

The player with the most words at the end of the game is the winner!

note: This differs from Fact in Five in that the timer and card categories are different.

name: Air Duel: Danger Zone
description:
The publisher's description: "Danger Zone is a two-player game of air-to-air combat between jet fighters. Each player pilots an airplane and attempts to shoot down opposing fighters. You maneuver to get your opponent's plane in front of yours, where you can shoot at it. The first player shot down loses."

The game features 6 scenarios from the Korean War through Desert Storm.

This game only had a limited release and was never formally published by OSS. The back cover of this edition states Special Gateway 1998 Convention Edition, Number 01 of 20.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Korean War, Modern Warfare, Vietnam War, Wargame

name: Pop of the Form
description:
Radio 1's Pop Music Quiz Game
Roll the dice to determine which question to answer. Answer the question correctly to score a point next to that number and another turn. Some questions have bonus points available. Answer six questions in a row for a 2 point bonus.
The game ends when a player scores at least one point against all numbers from 1 to 6. That player gets a two point bonus. The player with the most points wins.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Trivia

name: Words, Words, Words
description: Each player has to simultaneously make up words from the same set of letter cards which are dealt randomly. On each turn, all players are given one minute to select their best word, the longest of which wins the round and is written onto the playing board in a vertical or horizontal fashion. All subsequent words placed must connect, in crossword fashion, to those words already on the board. Points are scored for each letter written on the board to make up a word (as indicated on the letter card) plus bonus points whenever a bonus square is covered.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Spelling

name: Duell der Schamanen
description:
Two Shamans battle each other to win the title "The greatest Shaman".

Each player has a set of numbered tokens (1-9) and some shell tokens. The numbered tokens are placed onto the 3×3 playing area, one of each player in each of the playing areas.

After all tokens are placed the battle starts, by choosing the place the battle occurs. One player secretly chooses the row while the other chooses the line of the battle. Then the two tokens in the battle square are compared - loser pays the difference to the winner in shell tokens.

Then one player may switch the position of two tokens. After this the next battle starts.

The winner is the Shaman who manages to collect all shell tokens.

Quite nice little W. Kramer game which was published together with Knizia's Nuba.

Also a variant and predecessor was presented in Reinhold Wittig's SPIELECOLLECTION No. 1 Spiele zur Schatzinsel(1988)
The first edition, in 1978, was named Check-Point.

name: Piracy on the High Seas
description:
Each player must obtain a ship, captain and crew and attempt to take the loot from the treasure ship (or each other), bury it on Treasure Island and return with the map to Pirate's Cove.

Contents:

Gameboard
2 Six-sided Dice
4 Metal Ship Tokens
1 Gold Treasure Ship Token
1 Treasure Card
1 Treasure Map Card
4 Pirate Captain Cards
4 Pirate Crew Cards

name: The Good Ship Freedom
description:
From the box:

A Kafkaesque metaphor about Seekers trying to escape the political, religious, economic and other illusions that entrap them, preventing freedom of Mind and Spirit. Captain K sails to a dark, but enticing Land to look for crew to help cross the dangerous seas to Freedom Island. Constant PATROLS make it difficult for the crew to gather documents & gear needed to make a boarding at any dock. Players are the Crew, seekers after Freedom, helping each other round up credentials which entitle them to board THE GOOD SHIP FREEDOM and avoid those feverish Patrols who never tire vying for your very Being. Courage be with you, Seekers after Truth!

name: Earth Game
description:
From the box:

No, not a war game but a peace game ! Players look after Fictional Nations, managing resources and solving the emerging problems. You have to be quick thinking and compassionate to deal with rapidly changing circumstances. What to do? Try Consultation, Trade Agreements, Economic Communities, Training & deploying Peace Armies to cool out conflict, Planetary Meetings... The game is won when Spaceship Earth's problems are solved. The game is lost if you allow a World War to break out.

name: Brainy Games
description:
From the publisher:

These are 3 logic games for the clever to enjoy. Each game features a unique flipping strategy to keep you on your mental tiptoes and wanting to play the games over and over. Not for the faint-minded.

The Griddle Game
You are a team of short order cooks trying to cook up as many complete and unburnt breakfasts as you can.

The Invaders Game
Together you build a protective stone wall around castle, village huts, and farm fields to keep out the nasty invaders.

The Flu Bug Game
You are a team of Doctors trying to get rid of a spreading flu bug & make well the sick, among whom is Santa. Was there ever a better time to discover the power of garlic?

name: Swayze
description:
Swayze is a Quiz game based on today's news. The players take turns acting as the Quizmaster who thinks of a news item from recent headlines, using a special map of the world. The other players are panel members who try and identify the news event by asking questions. John Cameron Swayze lends his name to the game. Yes the same John Cameron Swayzee of TIMEX watch commercials fame. Back when this game was around Swayze was doing the evening news and was a pretty famous and well recognized newsman and TV celebrity.

A book comes with the game that has current events listed for different areas of the world just in case the Quizmaster cant think of any for a particular area of the world. Some examples of what's in the book; Mount Everest conquered by Hillary May 1953, Ben Hogan wins British Open July 1953, US Forces enter Korea south of 38th Parallel Jul 1950, Mohandas Gandhi assassinated Jan 1948.

Contents:

Tri-Fold Game Board
Clock Spinner
3 Green Wood Playing Pieces
1 Die
Magic Slate
Cardboard Inserts
Instructions Booklet
categories: Educational, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Willi Wichtel
description:
(From Funagain.com)

In a large meadow, in the middle in the enchanted forest, lives a small family of gnomes. No humans have discovered it so far. Do you want to try? Then you must first find a way through the mysterious and dangerous forest. Carefully creep past snakes, foxes and the giant spider. Finally you'll reach the meadow, where the gnomes live. Now you must look under each fern, each tree root and each stone, because the gnomes are true masters at hiding. Will you find them? Then you are first, and can make friends with Willy Wichtel and his family.

name: Noah's Ark
description:
A Memory Game - Match the Animals, Two by Two

For 2-4 players, Ages 4 - 7.

Can you remember where the female lion is? Where's the male monkey? This memory game has players searching for pairs of animals to put on Noah's Ark.

All the animals cards are placed face down on the trail of the game board. As players use their colored markers to travel around the board, the cards are turned over, ready to be matched.

All the female animals have bows, the males have ties.

As you find a match, you place the pair in your colored section of Noah's Ark. When all the animals are matched into pairs and placed on the Ark, count how many you placed in your section. Whoever finds the most pairs wins the game.

Contents: Game board, Plastic Ark with gang plank that fits into game board, 20 Animal Cards (10 male, 10 female), 4 colored game pieces, 1 die, Game rules.

Comes in a box with both English and French description and rules. Including a variant of the standard rules.

name: Zoography
description:
This game teaches children about animals and their habitats. The board is a map of the world. Players move around the board drawing cards most of which are pictures of animals. If an animal is drawn the player must identify it by name and place it in the area of the world it is commonly found. Others can challenge the choice at which time a guide sheet is consulted. The correct player gets credit for the placement of the card. The first player to place ten cards wins.

This game will encourage children to learn more about the world around them and the creatures they share it with.

name: Whirlpool Fishing
description: Spin the fish in the whirlpool and then try to pick one up with your fishing pole and hook. Pick up the most fish and you win!

name: Couplez
description:
A Christian Game of Wacky Fun for Newly and Not-So Newly Weds!
Wacky. Wild. Honest. Couplez, the zany game where Christian couples compete by stating the obvious and sometimes not-so-obvious perspectives of husbands and wives.

Developed from the HomeBuilders Couples Series presented by FamilyLife, Couplez stresses the importance of good communication-- listening and speaking honestly -- to help build strong and godly relationships by discovering the little things each other.

Proverbs 25:11 says, "A word aptly spoken is like apples of gold in settings of silver." Couplez really is the most entertaining and enlightening game you and your spouse will ever play! It's the perfect ice breaker for young and old couples getting to know other couples and each other better!

name: Combat! Normandy
description:
Combat! Normandy recreates the battles of the 82nd Airborne Division in Normandy, June 1944on a tactical level. Contains 280 die-cut counters, three map sheets, and fifteen scenarios.

It is advisable to play this game using the Combat! Rangers counters, rule book & play aids.

name: Triple Crown
description:
Pick your horse to Win, Place, or Show.

Players note secretly whether their horse will, place or show and collect betting tickets before rolling one of three dice and move their horse accordingly. Low payout for fast dice, high payout for slow dice.

The game has two repetitions of three races: short, medium and long. Short is one dash down the straight. Medium is one turn and one straight. Long is one full run around the track.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Convention!
description:
This is a roll-and-move game, but more complex than most. The outer track includes spaces for State Primaries, Ballots, Strategy Cards and Progress Report cards, as well as the entrances to various key Caucus tracks and to the risky “Smoke-Filled Room” where the party bosses will either heap rewards or boot you from the game.

Primary spaces are like Monopoly properties: the first to land claims them, and others then pay “rent” in the form of Uncommitted Delegates. Landing on the entrance to a Caucus allows moving along its track and maybe winning its large bloc of votes (but a later player can win it back). Players may hold Demonstrations by making a declaration; if their next three moves avoid any squares with negative consequences, he gets 30 delegates from each player and can move to any square on the board. Failure means paying 20 delegates to each player.

Whenever a player lands on a Ballot square, hands are scored, and the leading player wins a Bandwagon effect (50 Delegates from each other player). A player that gets ahead therefore tries to trigger other ballots as quickly as possible.

name: AGUA
description:
(from the English rules)

Travel like a water droplet around the world.

Water is the source of all life. The players of AGUA experience our exciting world in the shape of a droplet of water and collect all those experiences that water droplets can make on their way through the water circulation.

The players travel as droplets of water on various waterways through the world and collect experiences (i.e. experience points). At the beginning of the game four of the water ways on the game board are interrupted by 10 "holes" and cannot be used by the droplets. In the course of the game these "holes" are filled with experience points. The players will collect their own experience points. Their value again depend on the other experience points placed on the game board which can be modified by the players during the game.

The player with the highest score at the end of the game is the winner. The game is over when all "holes" in the waterways are filled, so that all waterways are permeable to the water droplets.

--end of rules description

The board is modular and has several sections which can be changed and several of each so the board will be different every time.

name: Trememo
description: This is a variant of Memory. There are three cards of the same motif. But on the first one the motif is sized 100%, on the second 200% and on the third 300%. The goal is to find the most trios.

name: Logus Sr.
description: Players form words using a tray 4 X 5 containing 18 letters. Words are formed by rearranging the letters within the tray.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Puzzle, Word Game
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Simultaneous Action Selection, Spelling, Tile Placement

name: Nerf Swish Shot Basketball
description: Each player picks a set of colored balls and begin shooting their balls at their basketball net. The first player to get all three of their balls through the net and into the ball tube is the winner.

name: Monster Dinner
description:
Six hungry Alien Monsters descend upon the sleepy town. The players are waiters bravely serving the monsters. The winner is the first player to serve the monsters and make it back into the kitchen, but incidents can happen along the way...
It is a blind bidding race game. Each player has 4 chips labeled A-D. A card is laid on each of the 4 tables pictured on the board. Players simultaneously bid by choosing the letter chip that matches the table the card they want is on.
Each card shows food items, the number of items on the card is how much many spaces around the board the card winner can move. If multiple players bid on the same card, none of them win, and their chips stay on the board until after the next round of bidding. Players do not count spaces with other players tokens on them, so being in the back can be an advantage. A clever enough blind bidding race game from the author of Ave Caesar.

name: Winner Spinner
description: The object of this game is to be the first player to get five Balls in a bank. But, you must get the first three of them in a certain order. First, the red - second, the blue - third, the yellow. The fourth and fifth balls can be any color and any sequence.

name: W3 Who, What, Where
description: W3 Who What Where is a card-based storytelling game. Players take turns to draw cards from a deck into their hands. Their goal is to gather enough W3 cards (Who, What, Where, When) to allow them to spin a story about the printed object, event, location, and time. The players then need to play a Story card to tell the tale and win the game. Other cards enable players to stop a Story from being told, add on more goals needed for a Story to be successfully completed, and to trade cards with one another.
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Spelet Om Fantomen-Skatten
description: This game appears to have come as an insert in a Swedish comic book devoted to the superhero The Phantom. The game map shows the Phantom's Island with four bases in each corner of the map representing the bad guys' lairs (Hydra, Scorpion, Vrakarna, and Singh Pirates). I do not have an English translation of the rules. From what I can surmise, the four criminal gangs are trying to steal the Phantom's treasures from the island. The hex-shaped counters are printed on the same insert as the mapsheet, and must be cut out and mounted prior to play.

name: Stretch Call
description:
Stretch Call is a horse racing board game. The game is controlled by a special deck of 100 cards consisting of ten sets numbered from 1 to 10, 10 horses, a game board, wagering cards, play money, a grease pencil, and instructions.

All players are bettors, with all horses moved by the cards. The cards are drawn one per horse per round. The cards are added and determine the horse's position behind a reference line drawn on the board. The reference line advances each round as the race progresses.

name: A Bug's Life Birdie Builders
description: Hopper's coming, and Flik needs your help. Save the ants by being the first to build a 3-D sparrow. Spin to get the sparrow parts you need. Finish first, and you win.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Skarney Kards
description:
Skarney Kards contains a rule book and score pad for two card games and 30 variations written by the late, self-proclaimed "World's Foremost Game Authority" John Scarne. Skarney Kards plays much like a simplified version of Canasta in which discards are passed around the table instead of forming a discard pile. Skarney Gin is much like Rummy except that, as in Skarney Kards, discards are taken back if no opponent accepts them. Skarney Gin also allows players to meld runs of mixed suits but an initial lay must consist of exactly 3 sets of 3 cards each.

rules for Skarney Gin found as varient under bgg for Gin Rummy

name: Noteability for Juniors
description: Now there's a special Noteability game for young players. It comes with a great looking electronic piano and 300 songs that kids can recognize. Players play songs for their partner who tries to guess the title. Notes are numbered on the piano keys, and the song melody is numerically coded on the song cards. Points are awarded for correct guesses and good piano playing, but no musical talent is required to have a great time playing Noteability Jr.

name: Detour
description:
The object of the game is to move around the world to San Francisco and end up the with the largest amount of cash.

Roll dice, follow the track, and occasionally take a detour.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Little Bear Leap Frog Game
description:
The game is inspired by the Little Bear book series illustrated by Maurice Sendak.

In this Roll and Move game, players follow the acorn trail and collect Owl, Hen, Duck and Emily discs.

The first player to head back to Little Bear's house after completing the task wins.

From the box
Join Little Bear and his friends for an exciting game of leap frog. It's "spin and move" race on an acorn track. Players "leap" over and collect an Emily, Owl, Hen and a Duck disk on the path. There are 2 paths and enough disks for everyone. Once you leaped all four of those characters, you must race back to Little Bear's house. The first player to get back with all four characters is the leap frog winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Murder à la carte: A Vintage Murder
description:
The year is 1937. You have been invited to dine in the sumptuous halls of Château de Reims in the lush wine country of France. But the promise of a sparkling evening is shattered when you discover that your host, St. John Sedgwick-Smythe, has been murdered. All of the guests, including you, were capable of masterminding his death. You all wished for his untimely demise. Which one of you fermented the plot for his murder? It's up to you to solve this crime before its time.

The Suspects:
- Désirée De Bouze
- Rose Chintsey-Curten
- Yves Le Concoction
- Seymour Hunter-Cover
- Henri L'Able
- Lotte Brenzenbraun

Contents:
- Party Planner Booklet with menu and recipes suggestions, along with music and decorating ideas
- Character Booklets for all six suspects, includes their roles and background information
- Six Place Cards
- Six Party Invitations and Envelopes
- Six Secret Clues
- Cassette Tape with an introduction, summary of events and the solution to the crime
publishers: bePuzzled, Lombard Marketing, Paul Lamond Games Ltd, Prism Leisure Corporation PLC

name: Rotten Egg
description:
This is an action game inspired by the Musical Chairs. Before the game, the electronic egg records each player's name. During the game, players toss the device to the player called by the egg. Players are eliminated if the egg stops on their name a few times.

From the box:
Gather all players. Three? Maybe more? And form a circle on the floor. Then talk to Rotten Egg and tell him your name. Now we're ready to start the game. One by one, your names he'll shout. You toss him to the person whose name he yells out. When Rotten Egg stops on your name, You are one step closer to being out of the game.

name: How to Get to Sesame Street
description: Spin and move your character along the game path to matching color spaces. Row across the pond, stop for checkers and slip down the slide to the letter X. Then hopscotch your way to Sesame Street. The first player to reach Sesame Street wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Naval Warfare '39-'45
description: 28 pages of miniatures rules for WW II surface, carrier, and submarine combat. No unit data or scenarios - just rules.
categories: Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame, World War II

name: The Cat in the Hat Comes Back Card Game
description: Players pile up little cats A-Z in alphabetical order to clean up the mess that the cat in the hat made. The more cats they play, the faster they win.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Wild Guess
description:
Wild Guess is a simultaneous trivia game based on numbers and statistics and comes with a set of question cards and a set of answer cards with the addition of some tokens, used for gambling for those players that feel they will be closer to the answer than any other.
A question is read by one player who estimates an answer and then tells the other players their answer, the other players then guess whether the answer will be higher or lower than that answer,they also guess what the correct answer will be. Scores are then tallied up for nearest and furthest answer to the question, with the highest scoring player winning over twelve rounds.

name: Panzers at the Pyramids
description:
(from Simulations Workshop website:)

What if the Afrika Korps had broken through at El Alamein? Rommel, the famed "Desert Fox," even sketched out a map of the pursuit into the Nile Delta had the breakthrough occurred.

German units are battalions, Italian units are regiments, and Allied units are brigades.
One day per turn, and 8 miles to the hex.

Rules are included for air strikes, interdiction, step reduction, limited intelligence, combined arms, petrol shortages, Rommel, the Egyptian Free Officers Coup, uprisings, German espionage attempts, flooding the Delta, and surprise air drops.

11 x 17 color map and 220 color counters.

name: Plimus
description:
An abstract game for 2 or 4 players, Plimus has plus & minus pieces moving against each other. The opposite signs attracts, the matching signs repel and you can stack your pieces and knock your opponents out. You win by getting your pieces to the opposing side.

Apparently this is a long long game, too long to be much fun, too awkward for tactics to endure.

name: Web
description:
From the English rules:

At the head office of Splotter-4-all computer services the phones just won't stop ringing: complaints galore! Everyone wants internet. Where are the connections?

WEB is a game in which the players attempt to connect as many computers as possible. More than anyone else at least. If that isn't possible by connecting more computers yourself there are other means. Stealing computers from your neighbors, dumping uninteresting contracts on them...in WEB everything is allowed.



========In WEB you build a variable board using L-shaped cards depicting computers, telephones and the likes. Using colored sticks you connect them with ISDN-lines. You win by connecting the most valuable computers.

name: Piraten & Papageien
description:
An interesting game that was a winner at the European Game Collectors Guild of 2003. A limited set of 300 have been made by Playme.de and were sold at Essen but also still available from their site.

The game board is nine by nine grid with some islands in certain cells. Each round, three parrots fly onto the board from directions based on die rolls. Players then select movement options from different-complex cards, and simultaneously decide how their ship will move. The Parrots fly and then the ships move, and when a ship "catches" a parrot it keeps it. But if later the ship moves across an island, they lose a parrot as it flies off the ship to look for food. Whoever collects the most parrots by game end wins.

name: Mary Dowser
description:
Mary Dowser is principally an auction and trading game, with a clever tie to the dowsing theme wherein players have the opportunity to dowse at various times during the game, thus discovering where water is available - and thereby which land will be the most valuable. The dowsing element is handled via a hidden magnet, which provides a slight pull upon the dowsing rod when connected.

Set in the American Southwest.

name: Mr. President USA
description: The predecessor to the original 1965 3M edition of Mr. President (and an entirely different game from the far superior 1967 and 1971 3M editions), Mr. President USA is a simple trick taking card game, with each state represented on a card and scoring based upon the states taken in tricks.

name: Adventure Cards
description:
In the Adventure Card series, players are trying to collect sets ala "Go Fish" but adds a memory and meld element.

There are two 24-card decks each with 6 cards of 4 colors each. One deck is separated by color and then used to form six four-card melds containing one card of each color. The second deck is dealt to each player plus one blind hand dealt face down. Players ask an opponents for cards and try to match the four card melds.

name: Passaparola
description: Game based on the Italian TV show "Passaparola"

name: Dalton City
description: Dalton City is a western-themed Monopoly-like game with some added chrome, including a figure-8 shaped board path, historical characters for pieces, and a "golden nugget" that offers special powers to the player that holds it.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: ZByte
description:
ZByte: hightech playing cards

ZByte is a modification of a normal 52 card deck that replaces the standard suits with logic gates: and, or, byte, and not. This not only changes the form, but it also changes the function of the cards. The symbols allow the cards to interact in new and different ways. The number cards also display the bit value and binary representation on the face of the card.

Included with the cards is a booklet outlining the functions of the gates as well as games based on the applications of those gates.

From the back of the box:

ZByte is a revolutionary new design in playing cards based on computers - the first logical change in 500 years!

Create and play a new generation of games for the twenty-first century.

Or play all your favorite traditional games, such as Solitaire, Black Jack, Poker, and Gin Rummy.

This 52-card deck contains the standard number cards, aces, jacks, queens, kings, but with four special suits, and two robot "IF" jokers.

Enclosed 32-page book has rules for eleven new games and instructions for ZByte game designers.

name: Pounce
description:
Two-player abstract played on an 8x8 grid. The basic pieces are tall columns belonging to either player.
